										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Cliff Stowe" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2393334&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Cliff Stowe</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Olivia Weber" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2395319&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Olivia Weber</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=503a390a-a3f5-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35446&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
										<p><span class="badge badge-warning">Group Not Registered Yet </span></p>
									
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35446" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35446', 'a-mission_35446', 'a-mission_35446');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Active Minds @ Harvard/CAMHS, is a peer education group under the umbrella of Harvard University Health Services (HUHS) that acts as liaisons between Counseling and Mental Health Services (CAMHS) and the Harvard College community. We work collaboratively with CAMHS, the Harvard administration, and student communities to promote awareness of issues and improve accessibility to resources related to mental health and wellness. In an effort to do so, we strive to reduce stigma surrounding mental health and engage in outreach to address the specific needs of various communities on campus. <br><br>We strive to encourage open conversation about matters of mental health and educate students about resources on campus. Ultimately, we hope to help the community to better understand issues of emotional well-being, recognize signs of students in distress, and feel comfortable navigating resources for support. 
							</p>

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Advocating Success for Kids website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257640/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35451" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Advocating Success for Kids" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35451', 'a-mission_35451', 'club_35451');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35451" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35451', 'a-mission_35451', 'a-mission_35451');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Advocating Success for Kids (ASK) is a primary care clinic at Boston Childrenâ€™s Hospital designed for children with behavioral and learning disabilities. Our ASK club aligns with this clinic; members serve as advocates for patient families. Our mission is to support the ASK clinic and its patients through advocacy work.<br><br>Harvard undergraduates serve as Advocates. They not only have the opportunity to shadow physicians in the ASK Clinic, but also serve patient families as well. Advocates provides a great deal of support to families including access to social and educational resources and an alternative line of communication to the Clinic. Advocates fill a key gap in the healthcare services that families of the ASK Clinic receive.
							</p>

											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {

												$("#club_35452").click();

												isActive = false;

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The purpose of ASAP is to provide the network and resources for Pan-Asian and Pan-Asian-American students across multiple disciplines including theater, film, dance, music, comedy, writing, entertainment, media, and more to make art and create a community for these artists. <br><br>ASAP aims to celebrate the community, experience, culture, and history of Asian students at Harvard with events such as group discussions, movie screenings, workshops, open-mic nights, group outings, panels, and large- and small-scale performances and theatrical productions. 
							</p>

				<div class="media">

							<a target="" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/student_community?club_id=35459">
								<img class="media-object media-object--bordered" width="80px" height="80px" style="padding: 3px;" alt="Association of Black Harvard Women's logo" src="/upload/harvard/2023/s2_image_upload_2382601_ABHW_Logo_5211040.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png';">
							</a>
						
					</div>
					<div class="media-body">
						<h2 class="media-heading header-cg--h4">
						
							<a target="" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/student_community?club_id=35459">
								Association of Black Harvard Women
							</a>
						
						</h2>
						<p class="h5 media-heading grey-element">
							Women's Initiatives
							 
								- No Dues Required, No Comping Requirement
							
						</p>

						
								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Hosted an Event!" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. Hosted an Event!" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2023/small_image_upload_34747_BadgeIcon_127133829.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>
							

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								     
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Association of Black Harvard Women website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="http://abhwomen.org"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35459" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Association of Black Harvard Women" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35459', 'a-mission_35459', 'club_35459');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=8c545957-a463-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35459&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35459" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35459', 'a-mission_35459', 'a-mission_35459');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Let us act as a catalyst in bringing Black women and other gender marginalized students on Harvard University's campus together for academic, cultural, political, and social purposes. Let us find strength, support, and courage in our unity and combine our intellect, spirit, and resources so that we may best address the needs and problems of Black gender marginalized students at Harvard College and within the University as a whole. Let us be actively engaged in the larger discourse on gender marginalized issues, particularly those pertaining to Black gender marginalized people, on Harvard University's campus, nationwide, and worldwide and contribute our energies to these causes. Lastly, let us maintain an interest and commitment to the overall Black experience, both within and outside of the Harvard community.<br><br>The Association of Black Harvard Women will firmly commit to the works of anti-racism and gender inclusivity, while welcoming and celebrating the stories of all gender marginalized people. We will also uplift the voices of the Black queer community and engage in unwavering activism by condemning injustices onâ€”and offâ€”campus. Finally, we will advocate for the end of rape culture, sexual assault, and sexual harassment on and beyond campus, prioritizing the safety and well-being of survivors.<br>
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35459").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35459").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Bach Society Orchestra, popularly known as BachSoc, is Harvardâ€™s premier chamber orchestra and is staffed, managed, and conducted entirely by undergraduates. We are committed to the study and performance of works for chamber orchestra, from intimate chamber pieces as well as mid-sized symphonies, selected from a range of historical periods, and to cultivating a strong community within the ensemble. BachSoc is similarly dedicated to increasing the accessibility of orchestral music; all of our concerts, which take place at least twice each semester, are free-ticketed and open to the public.
							</p>

									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Bengali Association of Students at Harvard College  website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257891/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35464" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Bengali Association of Students at Harvard College" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35464', 'a-mission_35464', 'club_35464');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Tanvir Haque" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2402793&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Tanvir Haque</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Sadeea Morshed" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2402162&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Sadeea Morshed</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=c40b586b-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35464&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35464" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35464', 'a-mission_35464', 'a-mission_35464');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Bengali Association of Students at Harvard (BASHA) is a cultural organization concerned with promoting the unique aspects of Bengali culture and fostering community among students with roots in Bangladesh, West Bengal, and the diaspora, as well as others with interest in the regionâ€™s rich history and traditions. Through our various social, cultural, and academic programming, we seek to provide members of the Harvard community with a home away from home, as that is what basha (à¦¬à¦¾à¦¸à¦¾) means.
							</p>

									$("#club_35464").keyup(null);

										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35464").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {

												$("#club_35464").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});

								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Sent an Email!" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. 						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Black Arts Collective website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/45476/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36199" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Black Arts Collective" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36199', 'a-mission_36199', 'club_36199');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Alyssa Gaines" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2392288&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Alyssa Gaines</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Saira Rodriguez" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2395031&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Saira Rodriguez</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36199" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36199', 'a-mission_36199', 'a-mission_36199');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Black Arts Collective works to address the on-campus social and systemic issues of how Black artistic and creative expression is too commonly disregarded by general art communities and derailed by those made uncomfortable by its presence. We build affinity through artistry by hosting events and makerspaces that center healing and joy as a method of collective liberation. <br><br>Our makerspaces provide a safe space for Black students to create, regardless of skill level and experience, for various creative disciplines, including but not limited to dance, painting, writing, photography, film, music, multimedia, and performance art. Our events are fun activities for everyone in the community to participate in, regardless of any interest in the arts. These include things such as parties, speaker events, art festivals, concerts, and workshops. We plan to have an annual showcase/festival of local Black artists including spoken word poetry, short films, dance performances, and original plays.<br>
							</p>

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								     
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Brattle Street Chamber Players website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://www.brattlestreetchamberplayers.com/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35466" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Brattle Street Chamber Players" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35466', 'a-mission_35466', 'club_35466');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=c43b6366-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35466&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35466" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35466', 'a-mission_35466', 'a-mission_35466');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of the Brattle Street Chamber Players is to perform string orchestra and chamber music at a professional level while exploring and promoting a greater understanding of both traditional and contemporary repertoire that is largely inaccessible to more traditional Harvard orchestras. Without a music director or conductor, we are committed to upholding the ideals of musical democracy, with logistical and musical endeavors solely led by student members. Our goal is to create an inclusive and collaborative community where all members can grow as musicians and contribute to the vibrant musical community of Harvard and beyond. 
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35466").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35466").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35466").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Concilio Latino de Harvard website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257383/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35479" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Concilio Latino de Harvard" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35479', 'a-mission_35479', 'club_35479');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_35479" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Concilio Latino de Harvard" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35479', 'a-member-benefits_35479', 'club_whatwedo_35479');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=c56b0820-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35479&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35479" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35479', 'a-mission_35479', 'a-mission_35479');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Our mission is to serve as a superstructure to give the Latino community greater cohesion and a stronger sense of solidarity among its diverse special-interest groups. Concilio Latino was historically the University-wide organization that provides a forum for dialogue, coordination, and communication for the Latine cultural, performing, political, social and publication groups on campus. Although University-wide in its scope, Concilio is currently focused on the Harvard undergraduate community in order to firmly establish itself as a student group. Concilio Latino's long-term goal, however, consists of incorporating the different Latinx groups from all the different schools at Harvard University. This year, Concilio will be redefined as a mediating, representative body to a) forestall event conflicts, b) publicize said events, and c) collaborate on large-scale, community-wide efforts.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35479").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35479").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;

											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_35479" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35479', 'a-member-benefits_35479', 'a-member-benefits_35479');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>Membership in this organization shall be open to all students in good standing currently enrolled in Harvard College, regardless of race, creed, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, or physical disability. Membership will consist of a maximum of an eleven member executive board as well as a counsel of all the presidents and vice-presidents of undergraduate Latinx organizations. Eventually, Concilio will be expanded to allow membership and involvement to the presidents and vice-presidents of graduate school Latine/x organizations. All undergraduate students are welcome to join Concilio membership to stay up-to-date on our events, including Latinx Convocation, Holiday Traditions Dinner, Senior Send-Off, and possibly a Latinx Gala, amongst other events. By being a part of Concilio, members are able to participate in open dialogue with other leaders of the Latine community, and be in direct contact with said leaders to collaborate and plan events and other programming.</p>

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Conflux website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/88270/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36200" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Conflux" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36200', 'a-mission_36200', 'club_36200');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_36200" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Conflux" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_36200', 'a-member-benefits_36200', 'club_whatwedo_36200');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36200" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36200', 'a-mission_36200', 'a-mission_36200');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								As technology continues to advance and play an increasingly central role in our lives, the intersection of art and technology helps us understand the complex and rapidly changing relationship between humanity and technology. Through researching, critiquing, and developing cross-disciplinary, innovative media that integrates technological development with artistic practice, the Conflux collective (confluxcollective.org) aims to expand the intersection of contemporary art and cutting-edge technology, pushing both towards a synergistic responsible, inclusive, and humane future. Conflux provides a supportive ecosystem for artists to challenge and critique the dominant narratives and power structures that shape our society, and for technologists to consider the ethical and social implications of their work. Moreover, through creating large-scale, participatory installations, Conflux practices what it means for humans and technology to create together. 
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36200").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36200").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36200").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {

												$("#club_36200").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});

Youâ€™ll have an exciting opportunity to learn about and investigate how the latest technology can be used meaningfully and artistically. Youâ€™ll work on imagining and developing methods and mediums specifically for art tech practice. Youâ€™ll help pave the way for how media and technology can help artists bring their visions into the world.</p>

To perform, in cooperation with Harvard University authorities, any other services deemed beneficial to Harvard University.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Datamatchâ€™s mission is to help students find love and friendship on their campus. We run Harvardâ€™s (and other universitiesâ€™) Datamatch tradition, which include an annual matchmaking survey, dates, and other events to encourage students to meet each other within their student body. In the fall, we also run a matching survey for first-years to meet each other once they get on campus, and in the spring, we collaborate with the Senior Class Committee to run the Match series of senior matchmaking.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Eleganza aims to use the power of fashion, dance, and music to unite students of all identities and cultural backgrounds, redefining beauty and aesthetics in the community and spotlighting diverse student experience and talents through our fashion and choreography. We strive to support this message not only by highlighting inclusiveness and marginalized identities in our show but also donating all of our proceeds to charities that align with our mission.

									$("#club_35501").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35501").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35501").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35501").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});

										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Amaya Butler" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394770&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Amaya Butler</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=c7b0b83a-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35505&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35505" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35505', 'a-mission_35505', 'a-mission_35505');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard's Expressions Dance Company (EDC) is a completely student-run company showcasing hip hop dance.<br>Founded in 1978 with its inaugural performances in the spring of 1979, EDC has a long legacy of artistic achievement which spans other forms of contemporary dance beyond its current focus on hip hop. The company is built on three guiding principles, which we strive to promote in all areas of the organization: Creativity, Confidence, and Community.<br>From company-wide social events to a series of open workshops, Expressions seeks to create a community on campus, bringing students together to dance, socialize, and learn from one another. All members, regardless of tenure or leadership, hold a valuable stake within the company and are to feel respected and encouraged at all times.<br>In Expressions, we urge our choreographers and dancers to incorporate a variety of styles into their movement and to use diverse choreography as a platform for their stories, emotions, and concepts. We welcome dancers to develop their relationship with hip hop through their own experience and understanding of other dance genres, techniques, and inspirations.
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35507" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35507', 'a-mission_35507', 'a-mission_35507');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We are the Fallen Angels, Harvard's premier, upper-voice, contemporary a cappella group founded in 2001. Every year we hold auditions, perform in Sanders theatre, and participate in additional gigs. Our goal is to make music and have fun doing it!
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35507").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35507").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35507").keyup(function(event) {

									<a id="a-mission_35517" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Food Literacy Project" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35517', 'a-mission_35517', 'club_35517');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_35517" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Food Literacy Project" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35517', 'a-member-benefits_35517', 'club_whatwedo_35517');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Gwen Koch" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2380368&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Gwen Koch</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=c8bc9237-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35517&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35517" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35517', 'a-mission_35517', 'a-mission_35517');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Food Literacy Project (FLP), is HUDS' food education initiative. With focuses on sustainability, nutrition, food preparation and community, the FLP seeks to empower everyone to make informed food choices. Every undergraduate house/dining hall has a fellow; FLP also has a presence at GSAS.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35517").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35517").keyup(null);

										var isActive = false;

												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {

												$("#club_35517").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Friends of Project Sunshine at Harvard Collegeâ€™s mission is to give Harvard undergraduates the opportunity to bring programming - recreation (arts), educational (tutoring and mentoring) and social service (HIV and nutritional counseling) - to children facing medical challenges and their families in the Boston area and beyond, by partnering with the Project Sunshine Project, which extends across 175 major cities across the United States and in four international satellite sites: Canada, China, Israel, and Kenya. Friends of Project Sunshine at Harvard College would focus on free services for medically challenged children and their families in the greater Boston area.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								1. Greener Scott Scholars will promote mentoring between graduate and undergraduate students on an individual and group basis increasing studentsâ€™ self-confidence and their sense of belonging.<br>2. Greener Scott Scholars will improve mentee/mentor interpersonal, leadership, and relationship skills while supporting the mentee as they adjust to Harvardâ€™s culture and environment.<br>3. Greener Scott Scholars will provide opportunities for specialized engagement and growth, as well as access to Harvard faculty, staff, and experts who understand minority dynamics through lectures, panels, and/or workshops for the collective group via club-wide 3-4 meetings per semester.
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_35530" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard African Students Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35530', 'a-mission_35530', 'club_35530');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Bessy Dushime" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2395179&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Bessy Dushime</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Joel Kizito" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394472&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Joel Kizito</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=ca1eaf67-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35530&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35530" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35530', 'a-mission_35530', 'a-mission_35530');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard African Students Association, founded in 1977, is an organization committed to nourishing cultural, intellectual, political, and economic awareness about the African continent. We are the Harvard community for students from Africa, connected to Africa, or interested in matters concerning Africa. Anyone who is intrigued by lively debates, art shows, cultural shows, music, and African cuisine will find a welcoming home at HASA. We are dedicated to building community and promoting collaboration amongst African students at Harvard, encouraging awareness of Africa within the Harvard community and the greater Boston area, and ultimately contributing back to our continent.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Architecture Undergraduate Society is dedicated to fostering the appreciation of architecture and the world of design at Harvard College. The club provides a forum for students exploring a wide range of academic disciplines to learn and contribute to the discussion on the built environment. Through seminars, excursions, workshops, and guest speakers, HAUS is a space to visualize the world we want to live in.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Association Cultivating Inter-American Democracy is devoted to strengthening and promoting democracy throughout the Western Hemisphere; the acronym HACIA is Spanish for â€œtowards.â€ Thus, our name helps to convey our main objective. In establishing HACIA Democracy as a Harvard student organization, each member is committed to the following:<br>
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Ballet Company is a student-run organization at Harvard College that performs classical ballet, contemporary, and modern dance. Our biannual shows feature choreography by alumnae, Company members, professional guest artists, and world-renowned choreographers. HBC also offers weekly ballet classes to all members; our Company classes are usually taught by our own Company members and professional guest artists. In addition, we hold a variety of community-building events and offer mentorship opportunities from our alumni.<br><br>Harvard Ballet Company has quietly grown into one of Americaâ€™s premier student dance groups. Since its creation in 1993, the company has continued to gain talented dancers, rising choreographers, and fresh ambition. Harvard Ballet Company looks to further studentsâ€™ dance education through a supportive atmosphere, classes, and performances, while simultaneously encouraging their academic passions
							</p>

									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Ballroom Dance Club website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="http://harvardballroom.org"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35538" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Ballroom Dance Club" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35538', 'a-mission_35538', 'club_35538');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=caeed489-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35538&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35538" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35538', 'a-mission_35538', 'a-mission_35538');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Ballroom Dance Team is a competitive dance team with no comp process, no auditions, no cuts, and no partner or experience necessary. We welcome all who want to learn how to ballroom dance, whether you've been dancing for 10 years or 10 seconds. We offer beginner classes for all Harvard affiliates, and we travel to Brown, NYC, and Montreal! With Harvard Ballroom, you're ready to own the floor. Check out our page, and feel free to message us with any questions!
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35538").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35538").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35538").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35538").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35538").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Black Men's Forum catalyzes the agency of Harvard undergraduate black men. We support our members through our core pillars of brotherhood, masculinity, and fidelity. Working with faculty and national figures, we provide a forum for discussion and action on issues pertinent to our body. We additionally seek to provide support for disadvantaged members of this country through various service initiatives like the David Walkers Scholars Program, a tutoring and mentoring program.
							</p>

									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Black Students Association website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://www.theharvardbsa.com/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35544" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Black Students Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35544', 'a-mission_35544', 'club_35544');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Ajani Barrow" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394117&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Ajani Barrow</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Alani Goins" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394261&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Alani Goins</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=cb653716-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35544&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35544" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35544', 'a-mission_35544', 'a-mission_35544');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The purpose of the Harvard Black Students' Association is to establish a sense of community, or more appropriately, communities amongst Black students on campus. The BSA shall endeavor to establish and promote interaction among Black students at Harvard College in inclusive and welcoming environments for all. The BSA seeks to uplift the voices of those who have been most marginalized such as Black women, Black queer folks, Black disabled folks, and Black low-income folks. In addition, the BSA shall endeavor to promote interaction among all members of the Harvard community.
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_35554" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Caribbean Club" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35554', 'a-mission_35554', 'club_35554');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard-Radcliffe Caribbean Club was founded in 1978 by a group of Caribbean students who aimed to foster a space where students of Caribbean descent and appreciators of Caribbean culture alike could bring some of the Caribbeanâ€™s warmth to the cold city of Cambridge. Founded during a period of increased Caribbean immigration into the United States, the Harvard Caribbean Club provided community and a voice on campus for the growing number of Caribbean students.<br> <br>Today, The Harvard Caribbean Club is made up of Caribbean international students, American-born students of Caribbean descent, and those who simply care to learn more about the small yet mighty region. Together, we celebrate our shared histories and traditions while also appreciating and learning about our differences. And together, we work toward our goal of promoting greater awareness of the people, affairs, and contributions of the Caribbean within our Harvard Community and any other spaces we enter.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Chabad is a home away from home for every Jew on campus. A place where students of all backgrounds and degrees of observance can enjoy exploring the Jewish heritage in a warm, welcoming, and non-judgmental environment. Chabad seeks to engage fellow Jews at their own pace and comfort level through innovative programs in all areas of Jewish life. Among our programs, we host weekly Shabbat dinners that provide students an elegant setting in which to meet new friends from every niche of the Harvard campus, experience the beauty of Jewish life and community, and explore and deepen their Jewish identity. Our creative holiday programs on the Harvard campus raise Jewish consciousness and pride throughout the university. Our lectures and classes on Jewish law, philosophy, and ethics, teach the relevance and depth of our heritage to our leadership community. 
							</p>

					<div class="media-body">
						<h2 class="media-heading header-cg--h4">
						
							<a target="" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/student_community?club_id=35560">

							</a>

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Classical Club website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257559/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35560" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Classical Club" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35560', 'a-mission_35560', 'club_35560');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_35560" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Classical Club" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35560', 'a-member-benefits_35560', 'club_whatwedo_35560');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35560" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35560', 'a-mission_35560', 'a-mission_35560');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Classical Club provides a wide variety of opportunities for enthusiasts of ancient Rome, Greece, and their corresponding languages and cultures to promote and celebrate the Classics. The club's activities include, but are not limited to, monthly dinners, classically-themed movie nights, the translation and production of a Greek or Latin play for the wider audience on campus, and the occasional toga party. The club also sponsors Persephone, a journal for undergraduate scholarship, translation, creative writing, and art inspired by the Classics. During the spring semester, club members organize and host the Harvard Certamen, a Classics-based quiz-bowl-style tournament for high school students that attracts schools from across the nation. Excitingly, in Fall 2023, we will begin formal planning for our Spring 2024 production of Senecaâ€™s Medea!
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35560").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35560").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35560").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35560").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35560").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35563" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35563', 'a-mission_35563', 'a-mission_35563');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Act on a Dream is a student-led, student-run organization at Harvard College focused on supporting and advocating for the immigrant community on campus, our local community, and beyond. <br><br>We have four pillars: <br>Advocating for legislative measures like comprehensive immigration reform and the abolishment of ICE, focusing on permanent solutions. <br><br>Building a community on campus that welcomes all migrants and backgrounds. <br><br>Pushing Harvard administrators to increase support for all undocumented students, TPS workers, and other members of our community, while centering community needs and demands. <br><br>Engaging in service to help the larger undocumented community<br>
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Albanian Students Association is an organization that unites students of Albanian origin and students interested in Albanian culture, history, and contemporary issues. The organization will raise awareness of social, economic, and political conditions that affect Albanians throughout the world through: community discussions, cultural (music/food/film) events, forums, and networking events.

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35571" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35571', 'a-mission_35571', 'a-mission_35571');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard College Association for Yan Xin Qigong is concerned with the learning and<br>exploration of Yan Xin Qigong (also referred to as Yan Xin Life Science and<br>Technology) - the foremost representative of the traditional Chinese health and science<br>system â€“ in the Harvard community by appropriate means such as publications, meetings,<br>seminars, and other research and educational activities. The organization will host all the<br>learning and practice activities under the academic and technical guidance of Dr. Yan<br>Xin. All the activities of the group are not any form of medical treatment or substitution<br>for medical care and will organize all the activities abiding by the rules and regulations<br>of Harvard and IAYXSLT; The group is against any forms of banned group activities by<br>any country, and would adhere by local and international laws and regulations of anti-terror,<br>health, social justice.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35571").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35571").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35571").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35571").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35571").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35583" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35583', 'a-mission_35583', 'a-mission_35583');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 1997, Harvard College China Forum is dedicated to a constructive dialogue on the challenges, trends, and issues affecting China. The forum aims to engage leaders in business, academia, and politics in a discourse that offers insights and generates ideas. HCCF is North America leading and longest-running student-run conference on China. The forum takes place every April in Boston, Massachusetts. Over a thousand delegates and nearly a hundred speakers attend the forum, making it the largest of its kind. 
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_35584" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard College Chinese International Students Society" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35584', 'a-mission_35584', 'club_35584');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35584" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35584', 'a-mission_35584', 'a-mission_35584');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard College Chinese International Students Society (HCCISS) is a vibrant and inclusive organization dedicated to fostering a sense of community, cultural appreciation, and mutual understanding among Chinese international students and those interested in Chinese culture at Harvard University. Our mission is to celebrate and share the rich heritage of China, support the growth and development of our members, and promote cross-cultural exchanges that enhance the educational experience for all students.
							</p>
							<script>

										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35584").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35584").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35584").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

Some of our signature events include the celebration of Chinese festivals, such as the Lunar New Year, Mid-Autumn Festival, and Dragon Boat Festival, as well as educational workshops, panel discussions, and social gatherings that cater to the diverse interests of our members.</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The intent and purpose of the Harvard College Debating Union (HCDU, formerly the Harvard Speech and Parliamentary Debate Society) is to develop and pursue excellence in debate in the Harvard community, and to represent Harvard University in intercollegiate parliamentary debate competitions. In addition, HCDU will seek to sponsor, organize, and run events and programs that make accessible the benefits of public speaking and debate to wider society (including, but not limited to, organizing competitions in collegiate and high school formats, demonstration debates, and community service projects). 
							</p>

								The Harvard College Indian International Students Association aims to:<br>1. Create a welcoming environment for Indian international students to connect, share experiences, and support one another.<br>2. Promote Indian culture, heritage, and diversity through events, workshops, and outreach activities.<br>3. Facilitate networking and mentorship opportunities among students, alumni, and professionals.<br>4. Advocate for the interests and needs of Indian students within the broader Harvard community.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 2004 by a group of Nigerian undergraduate students, the Harvard College Nigerian Students Association has grown both in numbers and respect, becoming one of the premier organizations for students on campus. Based on the shared culture and values of Nigerian and Nigerian American students, Harvard NSA has not only created a community for Nigerians to come together but has also spread an appreciation for the Nigerian culture throughout campus through various activities and events.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard College Polish Society is concerned with the political, social, and cultural issues regarding Poland. The Society will seek to promote greater awareness and understanding of these issues in the Harvard community through activities including, but not limited to, meetings, film screenings, talks and cookouts. <br>
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Our mission is simple: we connect the top leaders of today and tomorrow in a dynamic forum of exchange. The Harvard College Project for Asian and International Relations (HPAIR) was founded in 1991 to create a forum of exchange for students and young professionals to discuss and learn about the most important economic, political, and social issues facing the Asia-Pacific region. Since 1991, HPAIR has organized 49 conferences in 34 different host countries, touching the lives of more than 40,000 students and young professionals. HPAIR hosts two student-led conferences a year â€“ one on Harvardâ€™s campus and one in the Asia-Pacific. Prospective host cities in Asia must undergo an intensive, six month bidding process; this yearâ€™s Asia Conference will be held in Hong Kong.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard College Queer Students Association (QSA) is a resource organization concerned with improving the visibility, strength, and support of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, <br>questioning, and allied students, initiatives, organizations, and communities, in recognition of the marginalization that exists as the result of stigmatized identities. This group seeks to promote community and awareness of and be a resource with respect to the social, socioeconomic, political, educational, and cultural issues surrounding queer identities and sexualities in the form of events driven toward creating safe spaces in collaboration with other groups, institutions, and communities. <br>
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_36203" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard College Russian-Speaking Students Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36203', 'a-mission_36203', 'club_36203');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Masha Geguchadze" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2392963&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Masha Geguchadze</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36203" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36203', 'a-mission_36203', 'a-mission_36203');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Provide exposure to Russian-speaking cultures, societies, and the language to help the student population become more informed on Russian-speaking countries. Allow heritage/native speakers to find a community of people with a similar background where they are welcomed and encouraged to explore their identity. Immerse students of the Russian language in the cultures and promote language learning. Provide students with an open floor to speak freely about their experiences and ideas through events and meetings. Create a sense of community amongst all Russian-speakers. 
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Our organization is a chapter of the larger organization Massachusetts Menstrual Equity, whose goals include fighting period poverty in Massachusetts and beyond as well as removing the stigma surrounding menstruation. At Harvard, we have acted on these initiatives by ensuring that all restrooms have period products available to students, and hope to expand our impact by fostering a community where periods are no longer a taboo subject of conversation.
							</p>

		<div class="row" role="group" aria-label="Harvard College Students for Uyghur Solidarity">
			<div class="col-xxs-2_5 col-xs-2 col-sm-5 col-md-1 text-center">
				
						<div class="checkbox checkbox-cg--group" style="margin-left:15px;margin-top:0px">
							<input id="cb_club_36276" onclick="toggle_ecg('email_restriction_36276');toggle_ecg('div_waiver_36276', 'cb_club_36276', 'div_waiver_36276');onSelectClubToJoin(this);" type="checkbox" class="nb" name="clubs" value="36276">
							<label for="cb_club_36276">
								<span class="visually-hidden">Select Harvard College Students for Uyghur Solidarity's group. Select the group and click on the Join button at the bottom of the page to register for this group</span>
							</label>
						</div>
					
			</div>

			<div class="listing-element__title-block col-xxs-9_5 col-xs-19 col-sm-10_5 col-md-5_5">
					
					
				<div class="media">
					<div class="media-left">
						
							<a target="" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/student_community?club_id=36276">
								<img class="media-object media-object--bordered" width="80px" height="80px" style="padding: 3px;" alt="Harvard College Students for Uyghur Solidarity's logo" src="/images/default_club_logo_square.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png';">
							</a>
						
					</div>
					<div class="media-body">
						<h2 class="media-heading header-cg--h4">
						
							<a target="" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/student_community?club_id=36276">
								Harvard College Students for Uyghur Solidarity
							</a>
						
						</h2>
						<p class="h5 media-heading grey-element">
							Cultural and Racial Initiatives
							
						</p>

						

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard College Students for Uyghur Solidarity website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/500020/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36276" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard College Students for Uyghur Solidarity" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36276', 'a-mission_36276', 'club_36276');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36276" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36276', 'a-mission_36276', 'a-mission_36276');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The purpose and mission of Harvard Undergraduates for Uyghur Solidarity is to bring conversations, knowledge, and advocacy on the Uyghur crisis into conversations at the University. The group plans to host speaker events that focus on the academic and political parts of the human rights crisis. In addition to this, cultural showcases, displays, and celebrations are meant to disseminate the Uyghur culture and language to students at a time when the Uyghur people are facing a mass ethnic cleansing and genocide in Occupied East Turkistan.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36276").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36276").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36276").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36276").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36276").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Established in 2000, the Harvard College Students Piano Society (HCPS) is dedicated to fostering piano performance, pedagogy, and appreciation both within and beyond the Harvard community. We are devoted to forging a more intimate and united community of musicians, providing performance opportunities for student pianists and connecting pianists with the wider Harvard arts community. HCPS hosts masterclasses, workshops, and recital series with pianists from around the world. We welcome both amateur and professional pianists, and even non-musicians who just love music. 
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								HWC is a non-commercial association of undergraduates and other persons in the Harvard University community interested in Amateur Radio, organized for the promotion of interest in Amateur Radio communication and experimentation and education, for the promotion of public service with regard to amateur radio in the community, for the establishment of emergency communications in the event of disasters or other emergencies, for the advancement of the radio art and for the maintenance of collegiality and a high standard of conduct.<br>
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35692" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35692', 'a-mission_35692', 'a-mission_35692');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Community of Humanists, Atheists, and Agnostics aims to encourage consciousness of the various political, scientific, social, and cultural issues surrounding secularism and Humanism. Accordingly, HCHAA sponsors events, panel discussions, debates, social functions, and other educational and cultural programs. HCHAA welcomes members of every gender, ethnicity, religious background, and sexuality. We seek to maintain a positive and communicative relationship with other religious and political groups on campus, and welcome our responsibility to give back to the community, lending support to community service and political campaigns affecting secularism or Humanism.
							</p>

								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Hosted an Event!" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. Hosted an Event!" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2023/small_image_upload_34747_BadgeIcon_127133829.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>
							

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Composers Association website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257888/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35693" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Composers Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35693', 'a-mission_35693', 'club_35693');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_35693" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Composers Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35693', 'a-member-benefits_35693', 'club_whatwedo_35693');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=d92d7e86-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35693&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35693" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35693', 'a-mission_35693', 'a-mission_35693');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of HCA is to provide undergraduate students with semi-professional experience in composing, producing, and administration that they otherwise would not find through classes in the Harvard Music Department or elsewhere in the University. Harvard music classes, while they may offer performance opportunities for new works, do not offer room for students to understand the production of their works or to interact and organize musicians in a way that will be required of them professionally. With the decline of record company budgets, nowadays all musicians are essentially independent business owners, and sufficient resources are needed to replicate that type of environment. Additionally, all HCA composers will have primary ownership of their recordings, allowing them to publish works online to build portfolios. This decision is in line with the current trend seen at Berklee and other institutions to allow student ownership of works created while on campus. Students will also explore the legal side of the music business to understand contract terminology and publishing.
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_35694" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Computer Society" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35694', 'a-mission_35694', 'club_35694');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Cycling Club is a student-run club sport for cyclists of all levels. The team competes in the Eastern Collegiate Cycling Conference in the spring, and some members go on to compete in local-, regional-, and even national-level events in the summer. Anyone is welcome to join us! Please visit our website with more information about how to get started with HCC: https://www.harvardcycling.club/membership. Questions? Email us at harvarducycling@gmail.com. Join our mailing list at https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/harvardcycling.

									<a id="a-mission_35698" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Debate Council" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35698', 'a-mission_35698', 'club_35698');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35698" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35698', 'a-mission_35698', 'a-mission_35698');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 1892, the Debate Council is one of the oldest and proudest intercollegiate policy debate programs in the nation.  Committed to excellence in both competitive and educational achievement, Harvard Debate has won the National Debate Tournament (NDT) seven times, most recently in 2016, and finished second five times, since the tournament was first held in 1947.   The NDT records show that Harvard Debate has been invited to attend the tournament every year since 1954 â€“ a record of consistency unmatched by any other school.  In recent years, Harvard Debaters have won every major national policy debate invitational. For two years in a row, in 2016 and 2017, Harvard won the Rex Copeland Award for the Top First Round At-Large Team at the NDT awarded to the team with the best individual record in the regular season.<br><br>
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35704" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35704', 'a-mission_35704', 'a-mission_35704');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 1996, the Harvard Financial Analysts Club (HFAC) is dedicated to providing the Harvard student body with sound financial education programs and real-world investment experience. Through the HFAC comp, new members are given a ground-up introduction to finance with a focus on internship/career preparation. After completion of the comp, students can help manage HFAC's $40K equity investment fund, a portfolio under the direction of the club's student and alumni members. In addition to its weekly comp and fund meetings, HFAC hosts guest speakers from both academia and the finance industry.<br><br>
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Hillel is a Jewish home on campus that seeks to:<br>- Welcome students to experience the variety of Jewish identity, tradition, practice, values, culture, and community.<br>- Inspire and enable Jewish connection, celebration, and action.<br>- Prepare students to join, create, shape, and lead Jewish communities; strengthen the Jewish people, and live proud Jewish lives.<br>- Share Jewish sources, traditions, ideas, and innovations, and their relevance in our world.<br>- Forge connection and engagement with the State of Israel.<br>- Foster friendship in a nurturing and refreshing sanctuary amid the stresses of student life.<br>- Engage the unique opportunities of Harvard and make Jewish thought and culture integral in the life of the University.

							</a>
						
						</h2>
						<p class="h5 media-heading grey-element">
							Public Service
							 
								- No Dues Required
							
						</p>

						
								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Hosted an Event!" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. Hosted an Event!" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2023/small_image_upload_34747_BadgeIcon_127133829.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>
							

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								     
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Program for International Education website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://hpie.org"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35756" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Program for International Education" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35756', 'a-mission_35756', 'club_35756');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_35756" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Program for International Education" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35756', 'a-member-benefits_35756', 'club_whatwedo_35756');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Tasia Avery" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2392635&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Tasia Avery</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=def15a10-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35756&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35756" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35756', 'a-mission_35756', 'a-mission_35756');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The purpose of the Harvard Program for International Education shall be to create and foster interest in international relations in high school students from local schools &amp; pre-professional skills in students from humanitarian crisis nations. The Program's primary focus shall be to enable Harvard College students to conduct non-partisan discussion tutorials in these schools. The aim of this tutorial program is to communicate an understanding not only of the current state of world affairs but also of the theoretical foundations underlying this state, and to present this material to high school students in a manner accessible to them. Each semester of the program shall end with a role-playing simulation or exercise to which all of the participating schools will be invited. Every effort will be made to accommodate the logistical concerns of the participating schools.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35756").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35756").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35756").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;

											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);

									<a id="a-mission_35723" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Korean Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35723', 'a-mission_35723', 'club_35723');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35723" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35723', 'a-mission_35723', 'a-mission_35723');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Our central mission is to promote awareness about social, political, and cultural issues regarding Korea. All students are welcome to joinâ€” whether it is to find a tight-knit community, connect on the basis of Korean heritage, or simply learn more about different aspects of Korean culture.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35723").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35723").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {

										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35728").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {

												$("#club_35728").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 1986, Harvard Model Congress is a 501(c)(3) educational nonprofit and the nation's oldest government simulation conference run exclusively by undergraduates at Harvard College. First and foremost a teaching institution, HMC dedicates itself to providing an enjoyable and instructive atmosphere in which to develop a commitment to and interest in American government and civic engagement. Our primary goal is to teach and inspire the leaders of tomorrow.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 2001, HMCSF is one of the best civic engagement conferences under the umbrella organization of Harvard Model Congress, the nation's oldest government simulation conference run exclusively by undergraduates at Harvard College. First and foremost a teaching institution, HMC is also the most dynamic model congress simulation available to high school students.<br><br>Over the course of the three-day conference, HMCSF offers students the unique opportunity to assume the role of real-life senators, congressmen, and members of special programs to inspire debate, cooperation, and legislation--while also forcing students at the same time to expand their own perspectives and to understand the issues at hand in a new, more nuanced way.
							</p>
