								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Model United Nations is the oldest, largest, and most prestigious high school Model United Nations conference. Begun decades years ago with a simulation of the League of Nations, Harvard Model United Nations is the product of years of constant innovation and a commitment to substantive excellence. While our conference has expanded considerably since its incipience, now representing delegates from over 50 nations across the world, Harvard Model United Nations is committed to the same high standard of experience for every individual delegate. Harvard Model United Nations 2025 will continue to offer innovative and challenging committees, cutting-edge technology, and, of course, loads of entertainment for delegates outside of the committee.
							</p>

												isActive = false;

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35743" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35743', 'a-mission_35743', 'a-mission_35743');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard National Model United Nations is the oldest, largest, most prestigious model UN conference on the collegiate circuit. For now seven decades, HNMUN has been an annual forum for hundreds of college students from dozens of countries from around the world.  Every year, delegates from around the world come to Boston to discuss pressing international issues and defend their positions passionately. They learn how to negotiate with other people and collaborate with like-minded representatives. They work together on policy proposals and detailed programs in order to solve important global problems on a wide range of international topics.
							</p>

									<a id="a-member-benefits_35746" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Opportunes" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35746', 'a-member-benefits_35746', 'club_whatwedo_35746');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=ddf0c363-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35746&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35746" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35746', 'a-mission_35746', 'a-mission_35746');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 1980, the Opportunes are Harvard's oldest (and boldest) all-gender a cappella group. With repertoire ranging from the pop anthems of Ariana Grande and Beyonce to the timeless classics of Stevie Wonder and Michael Jackson, the Opportunes are known for their energetic performances, intricate student arrangements, and award-winning discography.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35746").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35746").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35746").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35746").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35746").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36247" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36247', 'a-mission_36247', 'a-mission_36247');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								By providing an avenue for students to come together in a friendly, inclusive environment centered around a sport that's accessible to a wide range of skill levels, HPC contributes to the development of well-rounded individuals who not only excel academically but also value the importance of physical health, community, and social engagement. Pickleball brings diverse people together: no matter your athletic background, pickleball is unique in its ability to be easily learned. This club builds existing and new social connections, provides an opportunity to explore fitness, to let loose and enjoy the sport and other's company, and teach the value of teamwork and collective unity to help serve the greater Harvard purpose of empowering individuals to contribute to society. 
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36247").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36247").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36247").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36247").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36247").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});

									<a id="a-mission_35751" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Political Review" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35751', 'a-mission_35751', 'club_35751');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35751" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35751', 'a-mission_35751', 'a-mission_35751');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 1969, the Harvard Political Review (HPR) is an undergraduate-run journal of politics, policy, and culture. The review addresses domestic and international affairs, as well as political discourse on campus. It also conducts interviews with political figures and experts ranging from Alan Derschowitz to Anthony Fauci to Kara Swisher. The HPR features student perspectives in the form of articles, podcasts, investigations, and data-driven storytelling. Staff writers work closely with editors to strengthen pieces while maintaining their distinct journalistic voices. Aside from the standard publication route, students are encouraged to participate in a wide variety of programs including the Red Line Investigative Fellowship, the Summer Fellowship, and Columns. They can also pitch topic ideas for and contribute to our quarterly magazine. Previous issues include â€œIsolationâ€ (Fall 2020), â€œGirls Girls Girlsâ€ (Winter 2019), â€œEngineering Earthâ€ (Fall 2018), and â€œBody Politicâ€ (Summer 2014). 
							</p>

										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Jang Choe" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2392929&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Jang Choe</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Laura Martens" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2395200&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Laura Martens</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=deb10cb0-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35753&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35753" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35753', 'a-mission_35753', 'a-mission_35753');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We, the members of the Harvard Pops Orchestra, endeavor to provide the Harvard community, the students, faculty, affiliates, and patrons thereof, with unique musical experiences. Through seasonal concerts built around creative themes, presenting an eclectic range of music from classical to jazz to rock, and employing theatrical and visual elements, we strive to create events that are not only enriching, but also highly enjoyable. In addition, we aim to cultivate the musical expertise of our musicians by scheduling regular rehearsals, as well as by encouraging students to conduct, arrange, orchestrate, or compose original works to be performed by the orchestra. Our overall goal is to play music at a very high level for the entertainment of the Harvard community.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35753").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35753").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35753").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35753").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35753").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Hosted an Event!" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. 							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								     
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Program for International Education website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://hpie.org"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35756" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Program for International Education" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35756', 'a-mission_35756', 'club_35756');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_35756" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Program for International Education" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35756', 'a-member-benefits_35756', 'club_whatwedo_35756');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Tasia Avery" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2392635&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Tasia Avery</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=def15a10-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35756&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35756" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35756', 'a-mission_35756', 'a-mission_35756');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The purpose of the Harvard Program for International Education shall be to create and foster interest in international relations in high school students from local schools &amp; pre-professional skills in students from humanitarian crisis nations. The Program's primary focus shall be to enable Harvard College students to conduct non-partisan discussion tutorials in these schools. The aim of this tutorial program is to communicate an understanding not only of the current state of world affairs but also of the theoretical foundations underlying this state, and to present this material to high school students in a manner accessible to them. Each semester of the program shall end with a role-playing simulation or exercise to which all of the participating schools will be invited. Every effort will be made to accommodate the logistical concerns of the participating schools.
							</p>

							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35759" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35759', 'a-mission_35759', 'a-mission_35759');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Radio Broadcasting, Inc. (WHRB, 95.3 FM) is a non-profit, commercial radio station run entirely by undergraduates. We have over 220 active members, an FM dial which reaches over 4 million people in the Greater Boston area, and 10 departments, which include classical music, jazz, blues, the record hospital (rock/punk/indie and more), the darker side (hip-hop/r&amp;b/edm and more), sports, news, sales, studio engineering, and tech. We also produce live shows featuring local artists, online content including interviews, reviews, and other journalistic pieces, and podcasts of all kinds. We are a vibrant and diverse community serving the Harvard, Cambridge and Greater Boston communities as an educational and cultural resource. And we want YOU to join WHRB's warm and welcoming community! Absolutely no prior experience or knowledge is required or expected! Our "comp" stands for COMPLETION, not competition! For more information about joining, please email president@whrb.org or comp@whrb.org. Feel free to check us out at www.whrb.org or find us on Instagram (@whrb95.3) or Facebook!
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The purposes of the Review have been and shall be to solicit and receive manuscripts of<br>philosophical articles, interviews with philosophers and other philosophical writings; to edit and<br>regularly publish, in various forms of media, a philosophical journal; to distribute the journal within<br>the University undergraduate and graduate academic community, as the officers may determine from time to time; to distribute the journal to university libraries, philosophy departments, other<br>educational institutions and the broader public; to arrange for and to present annual or semi-annual philosophical lectures at the University; if the officers see fit, to organize and sponsor regular bi-<br>monthly or other regular symposia for students (â€œReading Groupsâ€).
							</p>

									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Society of Black Scientists and Engineers website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257919/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35776" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Society of Black Scientists and Engineers" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35776', 'a-mission_35776', 'club_35776');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=e0a7d9d1-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35776&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35776" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35776', 'a-mission_35776', 'a-mission_35776');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Society of Black Scientists and Engineers seeks to support Black Harvard students pursuing degrees in life sciences, engineering, applied sciences, and other STEM fields. Our primary aim is to foster a sense of community among Black students in STEM at Harvard through offering academic and career advising, professional development workshops, help in the job and internship search, and various social events. We also seek to impact the wider Cambridge community by encouraging students to pursue STEM through mentoring and tutoring. Ultimately, we strive to combat underrepresentation in the sciences by facilitating the growth of black scientists at every level.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35776").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35776").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35776").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35776").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35776").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

								The Harvard South Asian Association exists to meet the political,<br>cultural, academic, and social needs of students who express<br>interest in the region of South Asia and the South Asian diaspora.<br>South Asia includes but is not limited to the nations of<br>Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, the Maldives, Myanmar,<br>Nepal, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka.

							<script>
								$("#club_35784").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35784").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35784").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35784").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35784").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Taiwanese Cultural Society (hereafter referred to as TCS) shall be dedicated<br>to the following goals:<br>1. To advance the understanding of and interest in Taiwanese culture and related issues<br>in the general Harvard community;<br>2. To cultivate friendship among students and scholars from Taiwan, of Taiwanese<br>background, or have interests in the Taiwanese culture;<br>3. To promote contact with alumni around the world
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Alnisaâ€™s Medical Alliance strives to foster a community of support and positive encouragement for Muslim female pre-med students of Harvard College. Harvard Alnisa is concerned with offering a platform for Muslim females at Harvard College either interested in or pursuing the pre-medical pathway. We believe there is a real need to empower this community through providing resources and mentorship for their advancement on the pre-med track, promoting the values of Islam in their goals and aspirations as future physicians, providing education on issues related to womenâ€™s welfare and health, and building a genuine camaraderie among students identifying as a member of this community. This organization will also serve as a forum for students to address the challenges faced by the broader Muslim female physician community and serve as a space of solidarity. Appreciating the slowly changing demographics of physicians in the United States starts with uniting the Muslim female pre-med community on Harvardâ€™s campus.
							</p>

								The Harvard Undergraduate Art History Society aims to create a community of students to<br>discuss and explore art history through both on-campus activities and museum excursions.<br>Members of the organization will explore the multidisciplinary reach of art history through<br>additional guest lectures and panels with people ranging from museum curators to art<br>critiques, and to professors. A diversity of perspectives is vital to a nuanced understanding of art<br>and so the multidisciplinary nature of the subject will be fully embraced.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Arts &amp; Crafts Club was founded to create opportunities for students of all identities, disciplines, and artistic backgrounds to create, appreciate, and celebrate the arts.<br><br>The ACC was founded by a group of sub-par (arguably terrible) artists of different disciplines, class years, and identities who share at least one thing in common: none of them have had any formal training in the arts. In fact, some feel that their talents never developed past finger-painting. <br><br>The ACC firmly believes in the power of some good old arts &amp; crafts, by bringing people together in a low-stakes, accessible, and fun setting.
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_35456" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Asian American Dance Troupe ( AADT )" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35456', 'a-mission_35456', 'club_35456');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35456" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35456', 'a-mission_35456', 'a-mission_35456');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								For over twenty years, the Harvard Asian American Dance Troupe (AADT) has sought to spread an appreciation and awareness of Asian culture through dance. Our repertoire includes a diverse range of dance forms including traditional, ethnic minority, martial arts, modern, ballet, hip-hop, and fusion. <br>In AADT, students of all cultural and dance backgrounds participate in bringing the variety, skill, and vibrancy of Asian dance to the stage. AADT is proud of our non-audition, all-are-welcome policy. Our pieces are student choreographed or arranged and feature both undergraduate and graduate dancers. We hope to encourage interaction and collaboration with other dance groups on campus and make AADT a reflection of Harvardâ€™s diverse and creative environment. 
							</p>

								$("#club_35456").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35456").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35456").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35456").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35456").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of the Harvard Undergraduate Association is to provide all Harvard College students with the best possible college experience. The HUA supports student voices, invites all students to participate, and is a central avenue for advocacy for the student body. In accordance with such, the HUA efficiently, reliably, and transparently promotes and protects student rights, such as providing a long-lasting, safe, and open forum for students to collaborate.

							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36188" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36188', 'a-mission_36188', 'a-mission_36188');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Association of Ghanaian Students is concerned with creating a close undergraduate community of Ghanaian students through the coordination of events and conversation that allows all members to feel valued, included, and empowered to succeed with the support of one another.<br><br>Our organization was founded in the summer of 2022 when five students from Twi AB (Benista Owusu-Amo, Emma Mensah, Maame Forson, Verda Annan, and Yvonne Burke) came together to form what is now known as HUAGS.<br><br>In our first year of operation, we hope to meet on a consistent basis, document all meetings/finances, plan at least two events per month, and ultimately connect all undergraduate Ghanaian-identifying students. We plan to host a Ghanaian Independence Day celebration annually. <br><br>As we embark on this process, we hope to expand to include graduate students, more board positions, and outreach into the Cambridge community and beyond. <br>                  
							</p>

								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Hosted an Event!" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. Hosted an Event!" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2023/small_image_upload_34747_BadgeIcon_127133829.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>
							

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Austrian-German Association website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/296111/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35612" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Austrian-German Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35612', 'a-mission_35612', 'club_35612');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Noah Guilherme Plattner" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394108&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Noah Guilherme Plattner</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35612" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35612', 'a-mission_35612', 'a-mission_35612');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Austrian German Association provides a welcoming and supportive space for students with a German educational or cultural background in order to share experiences of American culture and as Harvard students, including discussions of specific challenges associated with being a German Harvard College student, such as the transition from a German educational system to an American one. <br>HUAGA thus focuses on welcoming Harvard freshmen and exchange students from German universities by providing them with a network of students who have gone through a similar process and on whom they can rely for advice and support in administrative, cultural, and social matters. <br>The Association helps German students stay in touch with their home country by having a home community away from home, while fully involved in their life at Harvard.<br>Additionally, the Association serves as a forum for discussion about German politics, current events, and the like. To fulfill this mission, HCGSA will hold welcoming events for newcomers at the beginning of the school year, pairing them with upperclassmen, as much as possible from a similar background, and familiarizing them with the broader Harvard campus and with Cambridge and Boston. Bi-weekly dinners will foster a sense of community and provide a supportive network for all members. We also aim to build a strong alumni network of German Harvard College graduates. HUAGA graduates could then help current college students plan for future academic and professional opportunities back in Germany or Europe in general. h as possible from a similar background, and familiarizing them with the broader Harvard campus and with Cambridge and Boston. Bi-weekly dinners will foster a sense of community and provide a supportive network for all members. We also aim to build a strong alumni network of German Harvard College graduates. HCGSA graduates could then help current college students plan for future academic and professional opportunities back in Germany or Europe in general. 
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35612").on('focus', function() {

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35804" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35804', 'a-mission_35804', 'a-mission_35804');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Automotive Society is built around our Formula SAE team, where students design, build, and test a formula-style race car to compete in the annual FSAE competition. The competition includes static, dynamic, and presentation events that challenge students in engineering design, manufacturing, business strategy, and team communication. Our goal is to prepare undergraduates for careers in engineering and industry by giving them hands-on, team-based experience. Alongside our technical work, we host motorsport watch parties and community events to share our passion for the automotive world.
							</p>

Sent an Email!" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2023/small_image_upload_34747_BadgeIcon_127133918.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>

Hosted an Event!" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2023/small_image_upload_34747_BadgeIcon_127133829.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>
							

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Beekeepers website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/258036/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35805" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Beekeepers" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35805', 'a-mission_35805', 'club_35805');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=e303aae0-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35805&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35805" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35805', 'a-mission_35805', 'a-mission_35805');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We started with an idea in the Harvard Community Garden, but have since become an independent club. In the past, we have partnered  with the Food Literacy Project to bring bees into the important farm to table picture, and the Health Advocacy Project with a small honey-tasting event.<br><br>Since 2006, honeybee colonies in the US have seen collapse rates of up to 90%. As key pollinators, honeybees are directly responsible for cultivation of over 30% of the most important food crops. HUB seeks to stimulate active discussion on campus about not only the plight of the honeybee, but also to educate about the incredible world of apiculture. We would seek to bring together groups with important stakes in the fate of beekeeping. From all parts of the Harvard community, from the RoboBees Laboratory designing robots that mimic hive behavior at the School of Engineering &amp; Applied Sciences, to the Environmental Exposure biologists working to link between declining bee health and pesticides at the School of Public Health. <br>
							</p>

									}, 250);

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Behavioral Strategy Group (BSG) is a Harvard College student-led organization working to apply academic insights in behavioral economics to solve real-world problems. <br><br>Our team provides consulting services and is dedicated to helping startups, companies, and organizations overcome challenges by designing behaviorally informed interventions. <br><br>Our group organizes events that allow students from across the world to interact with world-renowned scholars and business leaders. <br><br>Our community started at Harvard College but is expanding to include students from schools around the world who strive to apply behavioral economics insights to solve the issues they care about.

									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Biomedical Sciences Forum website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/349969/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35808" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Biomedical Sciences Forum" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35808', 'a-mission_35808', 'club_35808');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Max Lee" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2402979&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Max Lee</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=e3443b72-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35808&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35808" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35808', 'a-mission_35808', 'a-mission_35808');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Biomedical Sciences Forum is dedicated to helping students build the skills to communicate scientific knowledge to audiences of all levels. The club hosts dynamic scientific presenters to discuss cutting-edge biomedical techniques with a focus on broadly applicable analytical thinking and fundamental principles. These events prepare students to understand and communicate future breakthroughs. Such skills are critical for undergraduates who will enter into scientific communities, science and technology policy arenas, as well as other fields. The club will host faculty members to demonstrate how fundamental scientific techniques and interdisciplinarity can advance diverse biological and medical fields. After hearing these presentations, members choose relevant peer-reviewed publications to present either individually or in groups at presentation dinners.
							</p>
							<script>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Biotechnology Club (HUBC) aims to provide students with access to academic experts, industry leaders, and seasoned investors in technology and the life sciences. We strive to provide education and hands-on training for students to explore and experience the broad range of careers that exist in biotechnology.<br><br>HUBC is committed to increasing diversity, equity, and inclusion of underrepresented groups at Harvard in both academia and industry.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								1.  The BCL should be responsible for making larger grander decisions for the community.  <br>2.  The BCL should promote collaboration to groups that appeal to the Black community at Harvard. The BCL should promote synergies rather than be a totalitarian governing body.<br>3.  The BCL should foster neutrality in making big Black community decisions <br>4.  The BCL should be a unified voice to outside the Black Community. There should be strength in numbers. The BCL should work together on initiatives of importance on campus. 
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Our mission is to create a space for health activism on campus and provide students with opportunities to critically engage with the Boston and Cambridge communities to address health disparities.

							<script>
								$("#club_35812").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35812").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35812").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35812").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35812").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_35812" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35812', 'a-member-benefits_35812', 'a-member-benefits_35812');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>Community and Belonging<br>Connect with other students who are passionate about health advocacy, health justice, and community engagement across a wide range of fields.<br><br>Professional Development<br>Access mentorship, internship resources, graduate and medical school panels, application workshops, and speaker events featuring public health leaders, physicians, policymakers, and more.<br><br>Advocacy and Service<br>Get directly involved in service projects and public health initiatives that address real needs in Boston and beyond â€” from promoting sickle cell awareness to tackling food and housing insecurity.<br><br>Skill-Building Opportunities<br>Develop leadership, advocacy, event planning, and project management skills through active participation in HUBHA initiatives and conference planning.<br><br>Participation in the Black Health Matters (BHM) Conference<br>Help organize and attend our flagship annual event, the Black Health Matters Conference â€” a groundbreaking gathering that brings students, faculty, healthcare professionals, and community organizers together to celebrate, learn, and build actionable solutions for Black health equity.<br><br>Cross-Disciplinary Learning<br>Explore how structural racism, public policy, healthcare, and grassroots organizing intersect â€” and how these connections can drive change.<br><br>Celebration of Black Joy and Resilience<br>Find spaces that not only address challenges but also celebrate the strength, creativity, and excellence of Black communities.</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Black Muslim Collective is concerned with recognizing, honoring, and celebrating the unique experiences, struggles, and identities of Black Muslim students on campus. BMC works to shed light on the experiences of Black Muslim students as they navigate these multiple identities as well as create and foster a sense of community among those who hold these identities.
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_35576" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Black Pre-Law Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35576', 'a-mission_35576', 'club_35576');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35576" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35576', 'a-mission_35576', 'a-mission_35576');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Black Pre-Law Association, founded in 2006, is dedicated to providing exposure, information, and resources to studentsâ€“black students in particularâ€“pursuing entrance into legal institutions and careers involving law. Although aiding the minority pre-law population is primarily our goal, exposure is not exclusive to those who are underrepresented. We aim to inform and be beneficial to all who are interested in pursuing law. We seek to offer resources that will enhance educational and professional opportunities for all students, while specifically targeting the needs of minority groups who remain underrepresented as members of the legal community. Furthermore, it is the responsibility of the organizationâ€™s executives to attract speakers, recruiters, and partners who are equally committed to ensuring that more students from these groups will be provided with resources that will aid their ability to be competitive candidates for law school admission.
							</p>

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Black Premedical Society website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257911/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35813" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Black Premedical Society" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35813', 'a-mission_35813', 'club_35813');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_35813" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Black Premedical Society" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35813', 'a-member-benefits_35813', 'club_whatwedo_35813');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Michaela Okundaye" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394695&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Michaela Okundaye</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Oliver Madubuike" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2395387&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Oliver Madubuike</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=e3adf030-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35813&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35813" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35813', 'a-mission_35813', 'a-mission_35813');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of HUBPS is to expose Black studentsâ€”historically underrepresented in healthcareâ€”to opportunities in the medical field. The organization aims to serve as a safe and encouraging space where Black students can discuss and navigate the unique challenges they face in medicine, particularly those relating to race and healthcare disparities. By focusing on case studies, hosting panels with Black medical professionals, and engaging in conversations about inequities in healthcare, HUBPS seeks to empower and uplift students interested in these fields.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35813").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35813").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35813").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35813").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35813").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_35813" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35813', 'a-member-benefits_35813', 'a-member-benefits_35813');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>Members of HUBPS gain access to a range of resources and events designed to support their premedical journeys. These include opportunities to network with Black medical professionals, participate in shadowing programs, attend panels and study breaks, and engage in community service and outreach events. Members are also included in a bi-monthly online publication that highlights medical breakthroughs and upcoming organizational activities. Participation in HUBPS fosters community, mentorship, and professional development in an inclusive and supportive environment.</p>

								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Club Sport Online Training (Spring 2024) " class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. 							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Book Club website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/500047/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36303" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Book Club" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36303', 'a-mission_36303', 'club_36303');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Justin Ji" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2392336&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Justin Ji</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36303" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36303', 'a-mission_36303', 'a-mission_36303');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Book Club (HUBC) seeks to promote reading for leisure outside of class, to facilitate engagement with the humanities, and to foster discussion about literature of all kinds. Through our monthly meetings, we hope to establish a vibrant community of book lovers, where students of all disciplines and walks of life learn about themselves and one another through the common act of reading. We believe that reading with others provides unquantifiable and long lasting psychotherapeutic benefits,<br>and hope to make our community a better place by sharing the gifts of reading to all those around us. In addition, HUBC seeks to conduct community outreach by publicizing our reads on social media, hosting<br>guest talks, and collaborating with external organizations to promote literary engagement across Harvard and beyond.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36303").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36303").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36303").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36303").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36303").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_36303" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_36303', 'a-member-benefits_36303', 'a-member-benefits_36303');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br></p>

									<a id="a-mission_35817" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Capital Partners" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35817', 'a-mission_35817', 'club_35817');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35817" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35817', 'a-mission_35817', 'a-mission_35817');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Undergraduate Capital Partners is an early/growth stage investment advisory student organization on campus that works for venture capital clients and exposes students to venture capital. We focus on giving students access to an unparalleled network of VCs, unique work experience with real clients, exclusive internship opportunities, and a tight-knit community passionate about entrepreneurship and venture capital. We believe that students should have access to real world experience in investing and entrepreneurship, as well as tangible access to funding and mentorship for their ventures. Follow us on Instagram (@harvardundergradcapital) or visit our website (harvardundergadcapital.org) for more information.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Girl Up is a by girls, for girls movement in which we aim to achieve gender equality by educating our communities and empowering those around us to take action so that every girl can reach her full potential. It is our mission to uphold the values set forth by the United Nations Foundation and Girl Up, stated above. The Harvard College Chapter of Girl Up exists to bring awareness, support, and solutions to gender equity issues facing the self-identifying girls and women in the Harvard College and local communities.
							</p>

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Climate Coalition website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/500049/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36305" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Climate Coalition" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36305', 'a-mission_36305', 'club_36305');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36305" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36305', 'a-mission_36305', 'a-mission_36305');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Climate Coalition(â€œHUCCâ€) is an organization comprising undergraduate students and student groups that serves as a space for connection, communication, and collaboration on climate and environmental topics within and beyond Harvard.<br>The idea for the HUCC came out of concerns from students already involved in undergraduate climate and environmental activities on campus. Many groups have fractured students among singular interests (i.e., conservation, clean energy, environmental justice, plant sustainability, service) as opposed to embracing students interested in other environmental niches or climate more generally. There is desire for a non-competitive, community-focused, student-led group in this area.<br>We aim to be a community hub, helping students to create connections and share ideas. We aim to show students how the climate intersects with each of our lives in countless unique ways. We are committed to upholding our principles of diversity, equity, and inclusion and centering the voices and leadership of those who are most affected by the climate crisis as we work toward a more sustainable and equitable future. We are committed to being non-exclusive and invite anyone to become a member of the group, attend our events, and engage with our projects.
							</p>

								The Harvard Undergraduate Creative Writing Collective is concerned with filling the gap in the creative writing community on Harvardâ€™s campus. Through mentorship, drop-in hours, networking events, book clubs, workshop events, speaker series, and service opportunities, we ultimately seek to create a radically inclusive, tight-knit community for writers of all kinds on campus (&amp; beyond), by: <br>â€¢	Providing support and accountability for writers working on projects<br>â€¢	Connecting writers with publishers, nonprofits, grants, and each other<br>â€¢	Organizing writing &amp; non-writing related events &amp; programming<br>â€¢	Partnering with other creative orgs at Harvard<br>â€¢	Serving the greater Boston community 
							</p>

					<div class="media-body">
						<h2 class="media-heading header-cg--h4">
						
							<a target="" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/student_community?club_id=36271">

							Creative and Performing Arts
							 
								- No Dues Required, Domestic Travel
							
						</p>

						

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Crimson Cellos website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/500015/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36271" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Crimson Cellos" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36271', 'a-mission_36271', 'club_36271');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Antonino Libarnes" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2403113&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Antonino Libarnes</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Brian Tollar" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2404945&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Brian Tollar</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=17d73663-b64c-11ef-aea7-0affd37d29fb&amp;club_id=36271&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36271" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36271', 'a-mission_36271', 'a-mission_36271');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of the Harvard Undergraduate Crimson Cellos is to foster a vibrant community of cellists by establishing Harvard's premier cello ensemble. Crimson Cellos aims to spread musical diffusion by challenging cello misconceptions, which include its believed ability to play only classical music and role as a relatively less prominent instrument in the orchestra. Our ensemble enriches both the Harvard campus and the greater Boston area through rehearsals, jam sessions, and performances at venues like Arts First, the Harvard Art Museum, and local hospitals. Additionally, we host speaker events and educational opportunities to inspire others to pursue music and encourage deeper engagement with this beautiful instrument.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36271").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36271").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36271").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}

											} else {

											}
										});
									}, 250);

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard College Deepam is a South Asian classical dance group. We have performed at various campus events, including Ghungroo, Arts First, and Cultural Rhythms. We choreograph our own routines, and focus on combining traditional form and technique with our innovations and experimentation. Our mission is to be a space for South Asian classical dancers to practice, learn, grow, and - most importantly - to find a community.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Disability Justice Club (HUDJ), founded in the fall of 2021, is working to build a large coalition of students with chronic illnesses, mental illnesses, and visible/invisible disabilities, as well as allies, dedicated to making Harvard College more accessible. The club is centered on studentsâ€™ lived experiences, but we welcome and encourage any undergraduates at Harvard College to join. You do not need to disclose your disability (or have one) to join or participate in club activities!
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Dominican Student Association is a cultural organization created to celebrate the Dominican and Dominican-American experience. We seek to provide students who are Dominican-identifying and those who want to learn about Dominican culture with a safe space to feel both represented and welcome. As an organization, we emphasize the inclusion of all identities and want everyone on campus to feel comfortable thriving in the space thatâ€™s provided by DSA. Through our various branches, we emphasize the importance of providing members with a safe social space, establishing professional networks to connect members to Dominican professionals and alumni, and of giving back to the Dominican community outside of campus. 
							</p>

										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Jingyuan Chen" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2393957&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Jingyuan Chen</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Lincoln Duckson" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2402628&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Lincoln Duckson</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=d053fc58-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35597&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35597" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35597', 'a-mission_35597', 'a-mission_35597');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We, the students of Harvard Undergraduate Effective Altruism (HUEA), are a group of undergraduates dedicated to doing the most good possible with our lives. We strive to help create a lasting community that uses evidence and reason to find the most effective ways to improve the world. We are mindful of our immense privilege and aim to make the most of the exceptional opportunity we have to effect positive change in the world. We are curious, open-minded and think critically and are willing to ask hard questions in order to help us figure out how to make the biggest change we can, both in our lives and while at Harvard.<br><br>
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Electronic Music Collective provides a collaborative and supportive environment for electronic music enthusiasts to have intimate learning opportunities with world-class producers/DJs (ex: Paul Van Dyk, Armin Van Buuren, Madeon etc) to refine their music and DJing skills through workshops, guest lectures, and collaborative events.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Our goal is to encourage collaborative and accessible discourse on pressing ethical issues and to supply students and the wider public with an ethical toolkit that they can productively apply to their daily lives.

												$("#club_35838").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_35838" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35838', 'a-member-benefits_35838', 'a-member-benefits_35838');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>Weekly Meetings: We hold weekly meetings where competing teams prepare their cases, developing stances based on the cases provided in the National Ethics Bowl Case Packet.<br>Scrimmages: Engage in practice scrimmages against other universities, debating ethical issues in preparation for Ethics Bowl competitions.<br>Ethics Bowl Competitions: Compete in Ethics Bowl competitions at regional and national levels, debating various ethical dilemmas with other teams.<br>Coffee Chat Series with Harvard Professors: We invite Harvard professors to engage in small-group discussions about their research and work at local cafes.<br>Club Collaborations: Partner with other organizations on campus to host joint events and discussions on issues of mutual interest.<br>Public Discussions: Host public discussions for the Harvard community about relevant topics, fostering open dialogue on ethical issues.<br>Socials: Throughout the semester, we host social events for our members.</p>

It also seeks to serve as an authentic Christian witness to the Harvard community, expressing the Good News of Jesus Christ, as set forth in the Holy Bible, through all of its activities and challenging Christians to develop a Biblical worldview and to live lives of increasing faithfulness to Jesus Christ.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Film Club organizes weekly screenings to promote the appreciation of film. HUFC is open to all: our movies sample diverse perspectives from all of film history and all parts of the world. Members enjoy the company of fellow movie-lovers while watching carefully curated films in a welcoming environment. 
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Undergraduate Food Lab aims to empower kids to cook and make healthy food choices. Volunteers teach weekly after-school cooking lessons for K-12 students at local youth and community health centers. Our classes help develop valuable cooking skills, as well as teach relevant concepts in nutrition, healthy eating, food science, history, and culture. Harvard Undergraduate Food Lab provides a collaborative environment for Harvard students with a passion for cooking to gain hands-on teaching experience while serving the greater Cambridge-Boston community.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We are part of a non-profit organization on a mission to bring improved healthcare to communities in the developing world! Since our founding in 2003, we have been dedicated to improving pediatric and maternal health in the developing world. Our chapter works to improve the health of children both here and abroad by teaching about health in our local community, collecting and sending supplies to FIMRC clinics worldwide, promoting awareness of these issues, and fundraising for projects that will contribute to FIMRC's vision of a world in which all children have an equal opportunity to benefit from modern medicine.

Sent an Email!" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2023/small_image_upload_34747_BadgeIcon_127133918.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Ghungroo website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/349982/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35845" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Ghungroo" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35845', 'a-mission_35845', 'club_35845');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35845" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35845', 'a-mission_35845', 'a-mission_35845');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Undergraduate Ghungroo is concerned with creating a student-run production centering South Asian and South Asian diaspora culture through music, dance, spoken word, skit, writing, and visual art.<br> <br>We will present research and perspectives on South Asian mainland and diaspora culture to a wider audience every year, continuing a 30+ year tradition. We create a space for undergraduate students across the college to explore South Asian culture and heritage through the arts. We hope to work in collaboration with existing South Asian affinity groups and performing arts groups to create a cross-cultural production. Our acts include skits and theater, spoken word poetry recitations, storytelling; instrumental arrangements, various choral ensemble pieces, and classical music acts, folk, pop, fusion, and classical dances that capture regional and trans-regional traditions; a set consisting of panels, balconies, floor pieces, and ceiling pieces.<br>
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The world is faced with a severe shortage of healthcare resources. Those who are most in need of help are often ignored by the major players in the medical space. GAMI aims to leverage the technical expertise and passion of students around the world as well as the invaluable experience of healthcare professionals to develop impactful technologies, policies, and programs and make healthcare accessible to all.

										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Kevin Wang" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2391087&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Kevin Wang</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Thomas Mete" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2393234&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Thomas Mete</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=e68ac280-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35847&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35847" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35847', 'a-mission_35847', 'a-mission_35847');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Global Education Movement is concerned with utilizing education in enabling students with the tools they need to think big. Our mission is twofold:<br>(1) to lead professional development conferences, encouraging students to become globally-minded problem solvers<br>(2) to serve under-resourced communities through workshops, equipping students with the practical skills they need to seek university admission and/or employment.<br>Essentially, the Harvard Undergraduate Global Education Movement is composed of a group of Harvard undergraduates who realize that, as students of one of the worldâ€™s most highly regarded institutions of higher education, we have the opportunity and responsibility to use the education we are receiving to inspire those not as fortunate. We want the promise of education to extend far beyond Harvardâ€™s gates, and far beyond our borders.
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_35525" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Green Medicine Initiative" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35525', 'a-mission_35525', 'club_35525');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35525" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35525', 'a-mission_35525', 'a-mission_35525');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Green Medicine Initiative aims to promote environmentally friendly practices in hospitals and other medical facilities as well as address the effects of climate change on human health. We devise cost-effective methods to aid healthcare facilities in reducing waste and energy usage in order to lower overall healthcare costs and promote environmental responsibility while educating about the role of healthcare institutions in the necessary sustainable transition. 
							</p>

									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35618" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35618', 'a-mission_35618', 'a-mission_35618');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								This organization is formed to:<br>1) Publish scholarly work in health policy, healthcare, and health law fields from academics, professionals, and students.<br>2) Provide students with the opportunity to learn about peer-reviewed publishing.<br>3) Provide a forum for a multidisciplinary discussion of health care policy. <br>4) Provide information and resources to students interested in health care and the changing landscape of medicine, through various speakers, meetings, publications, and other activities.
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_35628" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Italian Society" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35628', 'a-mission_35628', 'club_35628');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35628" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35628', 'a-mission_35628', 'a-mission_35628');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of an Italian Society is to promote an appreciation and understanding of Italian culture, language, and heritage among its members and the wider community. Through a range of cultural, educational, and social activities, the Italian Society aims to foster a deeper understanding of the rich history, traditions, and art of Italy, as well as the contemporary Italian society and its contributions to the world. The Italian Society also seeks to provide opportunities for language learning and proficiency in Italian, as well as opportunities for members to connect with one another and build lifelong friendships based on a shared passion for Italian culture. Ultimately, the Italian Society strives to inspire its members to become global citizens who are committed to promoting cross-cultural understanding and making a positive impact in their communities.
							</p>

							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36216" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36216', 'a-mission_36216', 'a-mission_36216');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								HUJPN is a think tank led by undergraduate students at Harvard University and a Recognized Student Organization (RSO) at Harvard College. Membership is open to students and scholars at academic institutions throughout the nation. <br><br>We aim to establish a nationwide platform where students, particularly undergraduates, come together to learn about Japan's policy issues with scholars and prominent figures in each field. The issues include domestic circumstances from inflation and population decline to Japan's relationships with foreign nations, particularly China and the United States.
							</p>

								The mission of HUKC is to build a community of diverse individuals who take an entrepreneurial approach to lifeâ€”fostering growth in their bodies, minds, spirits, and communities.<br><br>- Inspire and Empower: itâ€™s easy to get caught in the mix of greatness on campus, but by giving everyone a chance to build their â€œdaily resumeâ€ - the small, but essential daily wins that build confidence - it reinvigorates a sense of purpose and desire to challenge oneself in a number of ways. <br>- Foster Community: clubs, teams, and programs exist, but they lack intersectionality, focusing only on the physical, intellectual, emotional, or spiritual aspects of life - weâ€™re here to bridge that gap, providing value to core members and participants, without taking from them.<br>- Support and Feedback: whether itâ€™s setting a new goal or approaching the finish line of an ongoing race (not literal), this is a community that keeps members grounded throughout the process.<br><br>
							</p>

									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Ella Trembanis" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394055&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Ella Trembanis</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=5964e824-b040-11ec-9e75-0acdec7e683b&amp;club_id=36160&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36160" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36160', 'a-mission_36160', 'a-mission_36160');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Knitting Circle is concerned with bringing undergraduate fiber arts together within a relaxed environment. We provide undergrads from all class years, backgrounds,<br>and experiences a space to come together around the fiber arts and build new friendships.<br>Additionally, we aim to serve the greater community through the fiber arts. Each year, knitting circle members will organize a donation drive to a charity, such as a homeless shelter or animal welfare organization. Members will be encouraged to make items including blankets, hats, or mittens to donate to those in need.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Latina Empowerment and Development (HU-LEAD) Organization is committed to creating an environment that promotes Latina leadership and empowerment through the organization of an annual conference with attendees from across the nation. LEAD promotes the development of a professional network, introduces mentoring opportunities, and inspires women to reaffirm their commitment to their profession and goals. Our conference and supplemental workshops throughout the school year focus solely on professional development and the empowerment of Latinas to realize their full potential in entering society as leaders and professionals. 
							</p>

								Latines in Health Careers is a pre-professional organization whose objective is to provide undergraduate students with the resources to fully pursue their interest in a health profession. 										<p><span class="badge badge-warning">Group Not Registered Yet </span></p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36162" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36162', 'a-mission_36162', 'a-mission_36162');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								A student-run organization at Harvard that provides professional resources and support for Harvard Latinx students. LiFT's mission is to challenge the narrative of minority underrepresentation in industries such as business, technology, law, media and more. LiFT's presence on campus is threefold: pre-professional workshops, professional exposure, and a tight-knit Latinx mentorship network. These manifest in the form of industry panels, resume workshops, mentorship programs, networking nights, and more.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								YLC provides Harvard students with a hands-on opportunity to apply<br>their unique academic and personal backgrounds to inspire the next generation of<br>leaders. In doing so, we aim to nurture a diverse community of Harvard College<br>students equipped with skills to create meaningful and memorable experiences for<br>high school students, inspiring the personal growth of mentors and participants<br>alike. Whenever possible, all decisions made by the organization should be filtered<br>through these lenses to ensure that actions undertaken by the organization are<br>reflective of this mission and make progress towards this vision.
							</p>
