								- No Dues Required, No Comping Requirement
							
						</p>

						
								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Hosted an Event!" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. Hosted an Event!" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2023/small_image_upload_34747_BadgeIcon_127133829.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>
							

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Line Dancing Club website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/500014/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36270" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Line Dancing Club" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36270', 'a-mission_36270', 'club_36270');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_36270" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Line Dancing Club" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_36270', 'a-member-benefits_36270', 'club_whatwedo_36270');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36270" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36270', 'a-mission_36270', 'a-mission_36270');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Line Dancing Club aims to operate at the junction between community, music, performance art, and culture. Sparking from an observed lack of opportunity to engage with line dancing on campus, the club was founded to foster a welcoming environment for all students, regardless of prior dance experience or cultural background, to express their passion for line dancing while simultaneously learning new skills.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36270").on('focus', function() {

									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36270").keyup(function(event) {

								});

Any individual with an interest in line dancing is welcome to join, regardless of prior experience. Members must demonstrate a commitment to the clubâ€™s mission by attending practices and events regularly. Members will gain access to line dancing classes, a great community, and information of line dancing events in Boston.</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 1999, we are one of Harvard's award-winning, contemporary co-ed a cappella group. We perform shows twice a year in Harvardâ€™s historic Sanders Theatre, embark on world tours, and sing upon request at venues in and outside Greater Boston. Our members hail from all around the globe and from diverse academic backgrounds, but we are united by our dedication to the group and our love for a cappella. All songs we perform are selected and arranged by current and past members of the group. As a result, we sing music from a wide variety of genres, ranging from classic rock and hip-hop to top 40, R&amp;B, jazz and everything in between. 
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_36165" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Maarga" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36165', 'a-mission_36165', 'club_36165');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Ishan Tiwari" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2393185&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Ishan Tiwari</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Sammy Tin" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2393419&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Sammy Tin</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Feriel Terras" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2392142&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Feriel Terras</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36165" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36165', 'a-mission_36165', 'a-mission_36165');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Undergraduate Maarga aims to create a non-denominational space for members of the Harvard community to learn, discuss and practice the dharma as preached by the Lord Shakyamuni Buddha and the Buddhas that have come before and after him, enabling not only students from Buddhist families and backgrounds to continue the practises of their childhood, but also to educate other students about practises of the Buddhist world and of Buddhists around them. As Harvard aims to create a diverse living environment, where students live with individuals from different walks of life and where students continuously assess their values and interests, Harvard Undergraduate Maarga also aims to enable Buddhist students to celebrate their own unique identities and experiences, while opening up their experiences to the rest of the student body.
							</p>
							<script>

						<h2 class="media-heading header-cg--h4">
						
							<a target="" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/student_community?club_id=36263">
								Harvard Undergraduate Microbiology Society (HUMS)
							</a>

						<p class="h5 media-heading grey-element">
							Academic and Pre-Professional
							 
								- No Dues Required, No Comping Requirement

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Microbiology Society (HUMS) website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/500007/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36263" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Microbiology Society ( HUMS )" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36263', 'a-mission_36263', 'club_36263');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_36263" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Microbiology Society ( HUMS )" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_36263', 'a-member-benefits_36263', 'club_whatwedo_36263');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36263" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36263', 'a-mission_36263', 'a-mission_36263');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Microbiology Society (HUMS) aims to promote student interest and engagement in microbiology education and research on campus. Our mission is to foster a collaborative environment for students passionate about microbiology through journal clubs, guest lectures, research conferences, and exploration of diverse applications in sectors like infectious disease, pharmaceuticals, food science, and the environment.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36263").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36263").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36263").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36263").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36263").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_36263" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_36263', 'a-member-benefits_36263', 'a-member-benefits_36263');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>As a member of the Harvard Undergraduate Microbiology Society (HUMS), students gain access to a rich network of opportunities in microbiology research and education. This includes Rapid-Fire Journal Club discussions, hands-on laboratory experiences, and field trips to cutting-edge research facilities. Members can participate in our mentorship program, connecting directly with graduate students and faculty from Harvard Medical School and the Graduate Program in Bacteriology. Additionally, HUMS members have the unique opportunity to present their research at our annual Harvard Undergraduate Microbiology Conference, network with industry professionals during our career panels, and contribute to our "Microbe of the Month" social media campaign. Through HUMS, members also gain access to our database of microbiology research opportunities across Harvard and can participate in our community outreach initiatives, developing valuable leadership and communication skills while advancing their passion for microbiology.</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								In response to the recent explosion of interest in the university-wide Mind, Brain, and Behavior (MBB) initiative, HUMBB was officially formed in the fall of 2002. We promote multidisciplinary dialogue about, awareness of, and interest in topics related to cognitive science, while working to provide a sense of community among students interested in these topics.<br><br>Cognitive science is a highly interdisciplinary field. Accordingly, HUMBB represents a wide variety of academic interests, ranging from artificial intelligence to cognitive neuropsychology to behavioral economics.
							</p>

								Our chapter aims to promote awareness, education, and engagement in<br>neurosurgical care, particularly in underserved communities. We will work in collaboration with Harvard Medical School Mission:Brain and alongside medical professionals to provide outreach, advocacy, and educational opportunities related to global health and neurosurgery. The chapter will bridge gaps in healthcare access worldwide by supporting neurosurgical initiatives globally and helping connect students and professionals with resources and events.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Mock Trial Association is dedicated to furthering a passion for trial advocacy and the law at Harvard College. We are a student-run group which competes regionally and nationally in competitions organized by the American Mock Trial Association. These competitions consist of trying legal cases in front of real judges and attorneys. We seek to enhance and apply its members' acute analytical reasoning, strategic thinking, and rhetorical skills.
							</p>

					<div class="media-body">
						<h2 class="media-heading header-cg--h4">
						
							<a target="" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/student_community?club_id=36265">
								Harvard Undergraduate Moot Court
							</a>
						
						</h2>

							Academic and Pre-Professional

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Moot Court website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/500009/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36265" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Moot Court" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36265', 'a-mission_36265', 'club_36265');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Muhammed Khan" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2403163&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Muhammed Khan</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36265" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36265', 'a-mission_36265', 'a-mission_36265');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Our goal is to educate undergraduate students about details in the world of legal policy through the simulated legal argumentation that is provided through AMCAâ€™s program. This would allow students interested in pursuing a passion for the law an opportunity to do so as undergraduates rather than having to wait until they are eligible to enter law school. By working closely with a case (provided by AMCA) and having an opportunity to either argue in front of a panel of judges or write a legal brief that contains their ideas, students will be able to develop their argumentation skills and gain knowledge about the inner workings of our legal system.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36265").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36265").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36265").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {

												$("#club_36265").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Music in Hospitals and Nursing Homes Using Entertainment as Therapy is concerned with using live musical performances and social interaction to build meaningful relationships between Harvard students and elderly/ill residents in the Boston/Cambridge areaâ€™s assisted living facilities. At least once every other week during the school year, MIHNUET sends a group of musicians to perform a diverse program accompanied by time for socializing.
							</p>

									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate Negotiation Club website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/500011/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36267" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Negotiation Club" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36267', 'a-mission_36267', 'club_36267');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36267" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36267', 'a-mission_36267', 'a-mission_36267');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Negotiation Club is dedicated to educating and empowering students in the art of negotiation. Our mission is to provide comprehensive training in principled negotiation methods and practical techniques, enabling members to become skilled negotiators in both their professional and personal lives.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								HUNSA is concerned with the creation of a formal space for Harvard college students from Nepal / of Nepalese descent or any college student interested in Nepalese culture to come together and collectively discuss matters related to Nepal and collectively celebrate their Nepalese heritage. This organization also seeks to establish itself as a representative of all matters pertaining to Nepal within Harvard College.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Network of Enlightened Women educates, equips, and empowers women to be principled leaders for a free society. <br>Educate â€“ NeW educates women on campus and early in their careers on the principles of freedom and opportunity by hosting speakers, holding debates, and providing intellectual resources. In its education work, NeW serves as a thought leader, promoting independent thinking and providing intellectual diversity on college campuses and in public discussions on women, policy, and culture.<br>Equip â€“ NeW trains pro-liberty women to serve as leaders through campus sessions, national conferences, leadership retreats, and professional development programs.<br>Empower â€“ NeW cultivates a vibrant community of women through campus chapters, professional chapters, and our online presence that emboldens participants to confidently advocate for pro-liberty ideas in their schools, workplaces, homes, and communities. NeW also connects program participants with career-advancing professional opportunities.
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35857" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35857', 'a-mission_35857', 'a-mission_35857');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Undergraduate Nordic Club is dedicated to fostering a community for Nordic students at Harvard University. The mission of the organization is to gather students with a shared background as well as preserve cultural traditions that these students share; these may include events ranging from informal social gatherings to the celebration of national holidays.  Harvard Undergraduate Nordic Club will benefit the Harvard community by creating an inclusive and accepting space for incoming, current and former Nordic students of Harvard University. 
							</p>

									$("#club_35857").keyup(null);

											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;

												isActive = false;

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We're a student-faculty group that aims to increase transparency and solve problems on campus using public Harvard data.<br><br>Our flagship product is Harvardâ€™s first open data catalog, where weâ€™ve gathered dozens of public Harvard datasets in a free repository. Weâ€™ve used data science and data visualization techniques to analyze data on campus safety, faculty gender disparity, student government election turnout, and trends in concentration popularity, to name a few.<br><br>HODPâ€™s community includes over 100 undergraduates as well as several Harvard faculty: Nick Sinai, the former deputy CTO of the US and current HKS professor; Jim Waldo, the former Harvard CTO; and others.
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_36183" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate OpenBio Laboratory" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36183', 'a-mission_36183', 'club_36183');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36183" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36183', 'a-mission_36183', 'a-mission_36183');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We aim to change the paradigm of biological research by making the resources and funding to do impactful research accessible to all. OpenBio provides the space, resources, funding, and advising to help students turn their research visions into reality. Through this community, we hope to enable meaningful research and change the culture of undergraduate biology at Harvard and beyond.<br>We support student-led projects that have the potential to make a lasting impact on the world using biology. Additionally, we are committed to increasing access to scientific education and opportunities for underrepresented groups, as diversity is essential for progress and innovation. We are excited to work towards this mission and use biology to create a brighter future for all
							</p>

									$("#club_35644").keyup(null);

										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35644").keyup(function(event) {

											if (event.which === 13) {

											} else {
												isActive = false;

									<a id="a-mission_35862" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Pediatric Cancer Buddies" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35862', 'a-mission_35862', 'club_35862');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Eliana Bonbrest" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2393205&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Eliana Bonbrest</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=e962b967-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35862&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35862" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35862', 'a-mission_35862', 'a-mission_35862');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The purpose of this club shall be to serve as a â€œbuddyâ€ program for critically ill children receiving medical treatment in Boston.  The club shall work closely with other non-profit organizations including Christopherâ€™s Haven, the Ronald McDonald House, and Hospitality Homes to provide physical, academic, and emotional support to the children and their families.  This support shall be provided through weekly visits to both Christopherâ€™s Haven and the Ronald McDonald House, featuring group activities such as crafting, baking, and playing games, as well as through individual visits with Hospitality Homes families, meal preparation through Meals with Love, care package assembling and delivery, one-on-one academic tutoring, and fundraising.  Ultimately, our purpose is to support critically ill pediatric patients and their families as they undergo a difficult time in their lives.  
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35862").on('focus', function() {

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate PGP Chapter (HUPGP) is an affiliated, campus-based organization 'of the Petey Greene Program (PGP). HUPGP is committed to supporting the academic and career aspirations of incarcerated and formerly incarcerated individuals through high-quality tutoring and educational initiatives in the Greater Boston area. Our mission extends to educating volunteers and the broader public about systemic injustices within the American carceral system, fostering awareness, and advocating for meaningful change.
							</p>

								The Harvard Undergraduate Philippine Forum (HUPF) is a close-knit family of Filipinos, Filipino-Americans, and friends that celebrates and shares the vitality of Philippine culture and tradition with the Harvard community. Through activities from traditional dance performances to food samplings, HUPF offers the campus community a glimpse of Filipino culture. With its social and educational events and the camaraderie it offers, it provides its members with a uniquely Filipino Harvard experience.

									<a id="a-mission_36286" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Plant Based" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36286', 'a-mission_36286', 'club_36286');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									<a id="a-member-benefits_36286" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Plant Based" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_36286', 'a-member-benefits_36286', 'club_whatwedo_36286');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Shawn Mobley" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2391478&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Shawn Mobley</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Navin Durbhakula" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2384274&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Navin Durbhakula</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36286" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36286', 'a-mission_36286', 'a-mission_36286');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Undergraduate Plant Based is a student-led organization broadly focused on accelerating the transition to plant-centric food systems at the intersection of social justice, public health, environmental sustainability, and animal welfare. We hope to educate and empower the next generation of leaders to bring about a more ethical, sustainable, healthy, accessible, culturally appropriate, and efficient plant-centric food system. The purpose of this organization is to create a space for students to learn about and partake in the transition to sustainable food systems.<br><br>We aim to advance these goals using the following levers:<br>- Influencing federal, state, and local policies and initiatives<br>- Creating a plant-based community at the collegiate level and using this to effect change to food practices in university dining halls<br>- Generating mainstream attention on plant-based solutions through media coverage, campaigns, and outreach<br>- Collaborating with other student groups, non-governmental organizations, activists, and experts<br>- Incorporating relevant food systems issues into our events and initiatives, ie. food desserts, food justice, equity, and accessibility
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36286").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36286").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36286").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36286").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36286").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_36286" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_36286', 'a-member-benefits_36286', 'a-member-benefits_36286');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>Although our events will generally be open to all Harvard undergraduates students, HUPB members will join a tight-knit community advancing solutions to one of the greatest problems we face: food sustainability. In addition to joining communication channels with pre-professional and networking opportunities, we intend to financially and logistically support member-led projects in the realm of food sustainability. We also will invite many of our members to join our flagship conference, the Food 4 Thought Festival, for free. Lastly, we hope to financially support local food outings and other member-only excursions.</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35755" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35755', 'a-mission_35755', 'a-mission_35755');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Premedical Society is devoted to providing educational, support and volunteer opportunities related to medicine, and to foster the campus pre-medical community. We serve as a resource for students looking into a career to find out more about the profession and to meet important people in medicine. By encouraging the physicians of tomorrow to work together today, the Harvard Undergraduate Premedical Society does its part to build a spirit of cooperation, a spirit that is becoming ever more necessary in the medical profession.
							</p>

HUPS also organizes medical school visits, discounted MCAT prep courses, mentorship and volunteering programs, and special events, serving as a resource for students seeking a career in medicine.</p>

								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Club Sport Officer Online Training (Fall 2024)" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. Club Sport Officer Online Training ( Fall 2024 )" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2024/small_image_upload_2382280_BadgeIcon_815144713.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard undergraduate Premedical Society for International Students website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/500052/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36308" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard undergraduate Premedical Society for International Students" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36308', 'a-mission_36308', 'club_36308');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36308" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36308', 'a-mission_36308', 'a-mission_36308');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate PreMedical Society for International Students is committed to empowering and supporting international students who want to pursue careers in healthcare in the United States. Acknowledging the unique challenges faced by international applicantsâ€”such as limited opportunities, complex admissions processes, and financial aid barriersâ€”we strive to<br>provide a welcoming community where students feel included, appreciated, and guided. The club also aims to implement different programs and initiatives around health advocacy, serving underserved communities, and working with various organizations and professionals to address issues such as access to quality healthcare, health disparities, and the social determinants of health.<br><br>Our mission is to celebrate the invaluable skills international students bring, including cultural competence, cross-cultural communication, and global perspectives, which are essential to the practice of medicine. Through mentorship, workshops, admission panels, and networking with healthcare professionals from diverse backgrounds, we aim to create a space that fosters success, resilience, and community. The core of our mission lies in creating an inclusive, welcoming, and supportive community where students can learn from valuable mentors, physicians, and different healthcare professionals, as well as from each other, about navigating different resources and opportunities available to them inside and outside of the Harvard community.<br><br>By connecting students with upper-level peers and alumni who have navigated similar paths, we ensure they have the resources, encouragement, and support needed to thrive despite systemic barriers. The club aims to empower students who have international backgrounds and are interested in engaging in cross-cultural medicine. We believe that international students not only belong in healthcare but are critical to the future of compassionate and culturally sensitive medical practice and the practice of cultural humility in healthcare settings.
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_35866" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate PRIMUS" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35866', 'a-mission_35866', 'club_35866');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Japesh Patel" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2391765&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Japesh Patel</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Ting Ting Yan" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2391498&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Ting Ting Yan</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Jae Ji" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394872&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Jae Ji</a>, <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Carly Ramos" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394022&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Carly Ramos</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=e9c4daae-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35866&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35866" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35866', 'a-mission_35866', 'a-mission_35866');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard PRIMUS is concerned with the welfare and community representation of first-generation students at Harvard College. For the organization, a first-generation undergraduate student shall be defined as one whose parents or guardians have not completed a course of study at an accredited four-year undergraduate institution, or an equivalent and recognized qualification abroad.  <br>PRIMUS will seek to build more opportunities for learning for non-first-generation college students, in the belief that the broader Harvard community needs to understand the first-generation student experience. By communicating with non-first-generation students, PRIMUS will strive to dispel any stigma or stereotype associated with the first-generation identity.  <br>
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35866").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35866").keyup(null);

							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_35866" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35866', 'a-member-benefits_35866', 'a-member-benefits_35866');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>Membership in this organization shall be open to all students in good standing at Harvard  University as well as Alumni, regardless of race, creed, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, or physical disability.* Members must be registered students of any undergraduate or graduate school of Harvard  University, or alumni who are involved in the first-generation mentoring network.* It will be a  tenet of PRIMUS that members across the levels of higher education are an important aspect of peer mentorship. Membership shall be retained until the student severs relations with the University.  Membership will be retained during the vacation and recesses of the university. All members of the organization will adhere to the guidelines stipulated above. Payment of dues will not be a requirement for membership in the organization. All members of the organization may resign their membership by sending a written petition to the Secretary. </p>
							<script>
								$("#club_whatwedo_35866").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_whatwedo_35866").keyup(null);

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The two aims of the Harvard Undergraduate Psychedelics Club:<br>(I) Our first aim is to educate the general public about historical and current events in<br>psychedelic spaces including research, policy, art, culture, and industry.<br>(II) Our second aim is to create spaces for free expression and exchange of ideas,<br>promoting discussion of psychedelics, psychedelia, and adjacent values and<br>philosophies, including consciousness, art, and spirituality.<br>We are not blindly encouraging the use of psychedelics; however, there is promising<br>research on psychedelics in mental health treatment, and we celebrate the contribution<br>of psychedelics in cultural spaces such as art and philosophy.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of the Harvard Undergraduate Quantitative Traders (HUQT) is to foster an educational and supportive community which, through mentorship and projects, prepares students for careers in quantitative finance. HUQT is comprised of many of Harvardâ€™s brightest statistics, math, and computer science students. Our members are selected through a rigorous interview process and go on to intern and work full-time at the worldâ€™s leading quantitative hedge funds and market-makers, including Jane Street, Two Sigma, Citadel, HRT, Jump Trading, SIG, Optiver, IMC Trading, and more.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Our mission is to engage undergraduate students from any and all backgrounds in quantum computing. We aim to connect our members to faculty, researchers, and industry leaders from Harvard and beyond to help them learn more about quantum information and quantum computation, to expose them to research opportunities, and to build a diverse community of students exploring the quantum revolution.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								At HUREIG, we are committed to maintaining our role as the premier space for real estate on Harvard Universityâ€™s campus with our programs. Through The Development, we teach members the fundamentals of the real estate industry and how to valuate properties. The Investment Group, founded in 2022, gives more experienced members an opportunity to create investment and development pitches supported with quantitative and qualitative analysis. We welcome experts in the real estate field through our Speaker Series to visit us and speak to the members and non-members about their experiences in real estate. HUREIG collaborates closely with leaders in the global real estate industry-including industry experts, academics, and firms-to supplement the education offered at Harvard College.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								â”œÃ³Ã”Ã©Â¼Ã”Ã‡â•£Harvard Undergraduate Right to Life is a student-run, non-sectarian organization dedicated to the principle that all human life is of inestimable value and must be respected and defended from conception to natural death. We work for the illegalization of abortion, euthanasia, embryonic stem cell research, and other practices that deny this principle and try to reduce the instances of these practices in a society where they are legal. To this end, we write letters and editorials, host speakers, put up educational displays and posters, participate in walks, and support pregnancy resource centers.

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35873" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35873', 'a-mission_35873', 'a-mission_35873');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Robotics Club (HURC) seeks to provide Harvard Undergraduates with an opportunity to participate in exciting and educational STEM-related projects, to engage students in machine-building processes, and to compete in a variety of robotics competitions.<br>HURC seeks to encourage its members to always strive to create efficient and meaningful robots. Meetings will consist of robot and machine-building work sessions, programming work sessions, and engineering design discussions.<br>HURC encourages its members to strive to create efficient and successful robots. HURC members will form teams and build robots in an effort to develop innovative solutions to problems. Meetings will consist of machine building, circuitry, and programming work sessions and,  engineering design discussions. <br>
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_35873" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35873', 'a-member-benefits_35873', 'a-member-benefits_35873');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>1. Membership in this organization shall be open to all students in good standing currently enrolled in Harvard College, regardless of race, creed, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, or physical disability.<br> <br>2. HURC has a non-hazing policy for all members in accordance with college rules.<br>Membership is not limited to students of Harvard College, but Harvard undergraduates must make up a majority of the organization. <br><br>3. Membership shall be retained until the student severs relations with Harvard University. <br><br>4. Membership will be retained during the vacation and recesses of the university. <br><br>5. Membership is open to students of Harvard University at no cost. Members, however, are expected to pay tournament fees, team fees, or other fees related to robot-building. <br><br>6. If a member wishes to withdraw from the club, that member needs to formally resign by informing his/her team leader, who will in turn inform the rest of the board members.<br><br>7. Members of the outside community are welcome to participate in activities and programs. <br><br>8. Members are expected to respect each other. <br><br>9. Membership shall be terminated for any member who fails to acknowledge or follow the Constitution. <br><br>10. Membership may only be reinstated at the consent of the majority of HURC board. <br><br>11. Members are expected to inform their team leaders if they cannot attend a scheduled meeting. Members should remain in constant communication with their team and project manager throughout the semester. Constant communication is defined as responding to all communications within 24 hours, unless an appropriate excuse is provided as determined by the project manager. All exceptions shall be handled at the discretion of the project manager. Should a majority of the Board choose to terminate the membership of any member, he/she will lose all HURC membership privileges for the current term. The board also reserves the right to review and/or terminate the membership of any member who is consistently inactive or hinders the progress of his/her team.</p>

								The mission of Harvard Undergraduate Rural League is twofold:<br>1) Provide a supportive and inclusive community for rural students at Harvard University to meet, share experiences, and foster connections.<br>2) Leverage the Harvard communityâ€™s talents and resources to assist rural communities by organizing and participating in initiatives that bridge the gap in access between rural and urban communities.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36309").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36309").keyup(null);

											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36309").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36309").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

								The Harvard Undergraduate Salon for the Sciences and Humanities is a forum to discuss the past, present, and future relationship between the sciences and humanities.<br>Through group discussion and conversations with academics and professionals from various disciplines and of myriad opinions, members will critically and imaginatively assess the science-humanities relationship and determine how they can be integrated to address the greatest problems of the 21st century.

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35658" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35658', 'a-mission_35658', 'a-mission_35658');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of Science Club for Girls at Harvard College is to increase the self-confidence and science literacy of Kâ€“12th grade girls belonging to groups that are underrepresented in the sciences, through free after school programs that provide experiential learning, mentorship, and leadership opportunities. Girls work with mentor-scientists who model and foster leadership, affirm college as an expectation, and promote careers in science and technology as goals and options.  Science Club for Girls at Harvard College will work to create a community of Harvard undergraduate and graduate students dedicated to serving local Cambridge and Boston schools and generating enthusiasm for science through after school and extracurricular activities.  Science Club for Girls at Harvard College fulfills a need at Harvard College for a volunteering opportunity that empowers future women scientists, and it fulfills a need of the Cambridge community for free and educational after school opportunities. <br>
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35876" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35876', 'a-mission_35876', 'a-mission_35876');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Science Olympiad (HUSO) is an undergraduate organization dedicated to enriching the experience of middle and high school students participating in science activities such as Science Olympiad. <br>The national mission of Science Olympiad is as follows: <br>"Science Olympiad is a national non-profit organization dedicated to improving the quality of K-12 science education, increasing male, female and minority interest in science, creating a technologically-literate workforce and providing recognition for outstanding achievement by both students and teachers. These goals are achieved by participating in Science Olympiad tournaments and non-competitive events, incorporating Science Olympiad into classroom curriculum and attending teacher training institutes."
							</p>

							<a target="" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/student_community?club_id=36086">

							</a>
						
						</h2>
						<p class="h5 media-heading grey-element">
							Cultural and Racial Initiatives
							 
								- No Dues Required, No Comping Requirement

								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Hosted an Event!" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. 						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard Undergraduate South African Society website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257541/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36086" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate South African Society" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36086', 'a-mission_36086', 'club_36086');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=fde1f873-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=36086&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36086" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36086', 'a-mission_36086', 'a-mission_36086');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Given the unique political and cultural climate in South Africa, which is different to many other African countries, we wish to create a group specifically dedicated to this nation. This will provide a forum for South Africans and others interested in the country to discuss politics, network, listen to local music and celebrate South African traditions and holidays. We wish to celebrate our diverse culture, welcome freshmen, bid farewell to seniors and be a point of contact for anyone wanting to visit the country. We could also  be a bridge between the new Harvard office situated in Johannesburg and the undergraduate students currently at Harvard. Furthermore, we aim to be in touch with South African alumni network and faculty.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36086").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36086").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36086").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36086").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36086").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The HSSS seeks to promote greater awareness and understanding of social, political, and cultural issues in the countries of the Former Yugoslavia (Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Macedonia, Serbia, Montenegro, and Slovenia) in the Harvard community by appropriate means such as publications, meetings, seminars and social events.

									<a id="a-member-benefits_35669" aria-label="Membership Benefits" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Stand-Up Comics Society" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35669', 'a-member-benefits_35669', 'club_whatwedo_35669');"><span class="mdi mdi-star-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Membership Benefits</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35669" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35669', 'a-mission_35669', 'a-mission_35669');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								As the one of the youngest comedy groups on campus, HCSUCS has no stodgy old graduate board or years of tarnished history to fight against. This means we can and should always be at the forefront of inclusivity in the campus space. Stand up comedy is scary enough; we should do our absolute best to de-stress someoneâ€™s first time trying it! Everyone sucks the first time â€“ you know that. There are many people who started standup in the club, or joined senior year, and are now incredible (Harrison Greenbaum didnâ€™t do standup until college.)
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35669").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35669").keyup(null);

											}

											if (event.which === 13) {

												$("#club_35669").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of the Harvard Undergraduate Surf Club is to connect undergraduates with a shared love for all things surfing. The club will host surf outings throughout the year for beginners and seasoned surfers alike, exploring the breaks that the east coast has to offer. We hope to create a community that is an exchange of surfing knowledge to improve as surfers and as people. Additionally, the Harvard Undergraduate Surf Club aims to work through education and action to protect our coastline and reduce ocean pollution.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Hello and welcome to the Harvard Undergraduate Tap Company (HUTC), Harvard's College's premier tap dance company! HUTC was founded in 1999 by two Harvard undergraduates who felt strongly that a tap dance company was the missing piece in Harvard's dance repertoire. Today, we carry on our founders' mission to bring the joy and power of tap dance to the Harvard community and beyond. We are an entirely student-run organization dedicated to telling dynamic stories through rhythm and sound. In addition to offering weekly company classes with both student and professional guest teachers, we perform at Harvard throughout the year and also guest perform at other tap shows in the Boston/Cambridge area. To get in touch and learn more, please email: harvardundergraduatetapcompany@gmail.com. 
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Technology Review is a publication that explores the essentially human aspects of technology. HTR exists at the intersection between practice and theory, leveraging insight from both industry and academia. We aim to provide a community where undergraduates from interdisciplinary backgrounds can discuss the forefront of todayâ€™s tech scene and its societal implications.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We are a student-run research collective that aims to bridge the gap between academia and advocacy. We want to use the vast and uniquely valuable academic resources at our disposal, including world-class professors, networks of experts, and highly-accomplished students to tackle some of the worldâ€™s most pressing issues. With that spirit in mind, we have chosen two research focuses in the realm of climate change and American leadership legitimacy through coordinated domestic and foreign policy. 
							</p>

									$("#club_35899").keyup(null);

										var isActive = false;

											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {

												$("#club_35899").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate UNICEF Club, a student-run organization at Harvard College, is concerned with the humanitarian aid of children across the globe. Through various events and activities, we aim to support UNICEF in their goal to provide health care and immunizations, safe water and sanitation, nutrition, education, emergency relief, and more necessities to children.
							</p>

								Harvard Undergraduate Ventures is concerned with demystifying and encouraging active, informed, and meaningful participation in startups and venture capital amongst Harvard students. By building a professional network and a community of undergraduates and alumni, Harvard Undergraduate Ventures provides students with skills, resources, and relationships to become leaders in the entrepreneurial ecosystem. We co-host the annual i3 Innovation Challenge to support student founders with cash grants. We also host workshops, fireside chats, socials, and networking events. Finally, we highlight student founders and various opportunities on our newsletter, on our social media, and on our podcast.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								"Our mission is to provide comprehensive support to veterans at Harvard, fostering a welcoming community that encourages their academic and professional growth. We are committed to recognizing the unique needs and challenges facing veterans and to providing the resources and guidance necessary to help them succeed.<br><br>Our organization offers a variety of services to support veterans, including mentorship opportunities, workshops, and training sessions that address topics such as academic and career development, financial planning, and mental health. We collaborate with other groups and organizations that serve veterans to provide additional resources and support.<br><br>At our core, we believe that veterans bring valuable skills, experiences, and perspectives to our campus, and we are dedicated to creating a more inclusive and supportive environment that recognizes and celebrates their service and contributions. Through our efforts, we aim to empower veterans to reach their full potential, both academically and professionally, and to build a stronger, more diverse community that values and supports their unique experiences."
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35689" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35689', 'a-mission_35689', 'a-mission_35689');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Pliny the Elderâ€™s wise words â€œIn Vino Veritasâ€ illustrate the belief that in wine there is truth. To illuminate another interpretation of the old Latin adage, the Harvard Undergraduate Wine Society was founded in 2011 with the philosophy of re-establishing the tradition of respecting and revering wine. We aim to promote social drinking in a responsible environment by cultivating an appreciation and understanding of wine, and to provide a common space for undergraduate students to meet and interact through the enjoyment of wine.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Undergraduate Women in Business (HUWIB) seeks to empower a dynamic group of enterprising young women, uniting them through business education and experience.  Serving the entire female Harvard undergraduate population, HUWIB is overseen by an Executive Board and eleven committees. 
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_35910" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_35910', 'a-member-benefits_35910', 'a-member-benefits_35910');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>HUWIB offers a unique opportunity for undergraduate women at Harvard to expand and sharpen their knowledge of business opportunities, giving them the skills they will need to become future leaders in the corporate world. Over the years, HUWIB has cultivated close relationships with many companies in different sectors of the business world, including investment banking, consulting, financial services, software technology, entrepreneurship, marketing, and more. HUWIB also works closely with Harvard Business School and other female-oriented business organizations. Membership in HUWIB requires completion of the 10-week WIBternship in which prospective members attend skill-building business panels and work with others on mini-projects. Once part of the HUWIB network, associates are encouraged to apply for committee positions where they help coordinate and execute the planning for the fastest-growing and largest women's organization on campus. Associates enjoy the opportunity to gain a variety of management and organizational skill sets, from finance and development to marketing, design, and production.</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35911" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35911', 'a-mission_35911', 'a-mission_35911');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								WICS is dedicated to building a community of technical women at Harvard and beyond. We<br>believe every woman should have equal opportunity and encouragement to pursue computer<br>science. We seek to empower women to consider careers in technology by providing education,<br>mentorship, and role models for students at Harvard and in the greater Boston community. We<br>strive to promote awareness of gender issues and to construct an environment for discussion<br>and reform across universities and industries. We hope to create opportunities for individuals of<br>all genders and interests to support these goals.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Undergraduate Women in Foreign Policy (HUWiFP) is a student organization for female-identifying undergraduates looking to learn from and connect with peers and professionals in the fields of Foreign Policy, diplomacy, national Security, and intelligence. HUWIFP aims to empower young women in the exploration of foreign policy Career trajectories while fostering a sense of foreign policy community on campus.

									<a id="a-mission_36217" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard Undergraduate Women in Law Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36217', 'a-mission_36217', 'club_36217');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36217" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36217', 'a-mission_36217', 'a-mission_36217');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Women in Law Association (WiLA) strives to bridge the gap that exists for students with marginalized gender identities, including women, nonbinary, and femme individuals interested in pursuing law. Gender historically and continues to pose unique challenges for people navigating legal careers. <br>
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								HUBS is a team of Democrats, Republicans, and everything in between, working to facilitate open policy discussions and craft bipartisan solutions. We author real legislation, meet prominent political figures, and bridge campus and national divides.<br>

								$("#club_35918").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35918").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35918").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35918").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35918").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Harvard Undergraduates for Inclusion in Economics (HUIE) believes in increasing diversity and inclusion in economics for people who belong to under-represented groups. The organization hopes to achieve this by creating mentorship opportunities, connecting students to faculty and staff, organizing events showcasing the diversity of post-graduation paths in economics, and fostering a stronger sense of community among students interested in economics. 
							</p>

By working in both education and policy-based change, we strive to break down systemic barriers and create a more equitable society where all youth can thrive.Through research, advocacy, and community engagement, we seek to effect meaningful legislative reforms that prioritize the well-being and dignity of all young people.

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Harvard University Choir website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257545/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35924" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Harvard University Choir" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35924', 'a-mission_35924', 'club_35924');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35924" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35924', 'a-mission_35924', 'a-mission_35924');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard University Choir sings for the Sunday services and the annual Christmas Carol Services in The Memorial Church, and presents concerts of choral literature throughout the year. The sixteen Choral Fellows sing for the daily Morning Prayers service Mondays through Fridays during term. When the opportunity presents itself, the choir produces professional recordings and travels both domestically and abroad. The Harvard University Choir seeks to adhere to the highest professional standards of music-making, while fostering a profound sense of community amongst its members.<br><br>Membership in this organization is open to all students and affiliates of Harvard University in good standing, regardless of race, creed, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation or physical disability. All officers of the choir shall be registered undergraduates in Harvard College.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35924").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35924").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35924").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35924").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35924").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35936" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35936', 'a-mission_35936', 'a-mission_35936');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The purposes of this organization shall be: (1) to provide college and university students throughout the world with a conference that authentically simulates the workings of specified committees and specialized agencies of the United Nations; (2) to foster an understanding of the intricacies of international negotiation by encouraging active participation of students as United Nations delegates; (3) to provide Harvard students with an opportunity, which they may not have otherwise, to travel abroad and meet their peers from foreign nations and cultures in a common forum; (4) to promote a general awareness at Harvard of the growing importance of the United Nations as an arbiter of international conflicts; and (5) to distinguish Harvard as an institution concerned with educating the international community on the United Nations.
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35941" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35941', 'a-mission_35941', 'a-mission_35941');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								AAA strives to unite Asian American students at Harvard and raise greater awareness of Asian American issues through social, cultural, and political events. We aim to:<br><br>Foster a community within Harvard dedicated to embracing our shared identity and promoting greater awareness of Asian American issues and perspectives;<br>Provide a forum for Asian Americans at Harvard to voice their opinions and comfortably explore their culture, identity, and individuality;<br>Address political, economic, and social issues affecting our communities at Harvard as well as at the local and national levels;<br>Celebrate achievements of Asian Americans, including those in the arts, entertainment, politics, business, science, and academia;<br>Develop long-lasting partnerships between students, alumni, community activists, and scholars;<br>Inspire participants to contemplate their roles and responsibilities in forging the future of Asian America.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Asian American Womenâ€™s Association (AAWA) recognizes the need for a<br>supportive, vocal community for Asian American women at Harvard. AAWA strives to address these needs through open and accessible dialogue and inclusive community-building events. By generating discussion about and spreading awareness of issues that pertain to the varied experiences of the members of our community, AAWA seeks to promote and celebrate the joy, prominence, and concerns of people who can identify with the experiences of Asian American womenhood in a way that is accessible and pertinent to the greater Harvard community

								We, the Harvard-Radcliffe Collegium Musicum, strive to advance the choral art through dynamic performances of both classical masterpieces and innovative new works; foster a passionate community of student musicians; and spread a love for music through collaborative endeavors, tours, and community engagement.

								The Harvard-Radcliffe Gilbert &amp; Sullivan Players (HRG&amp;SP) is an independent, nonprofit, student-run theatrical organization at Harvard College dedicated to performing the work of William Schwenck Gilbert and Sir Arthur Sullivan. HRG&amp;SP presents one production each semester in Radcliffe's historic Agassiz Theatre, fosters community among its participants, and seeks to promote appreciation and awareness of the works of Gilbert &amp; Sullivan in the greater Harvard and Boston communities.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Established in 1976, The Harvard-Radcliffe Modern Dance Company (HRMDC) is the oldest dance organization at Harvard College. We are a contemporary dance group that welcomes a wide variety of dance styles, and we are dedicated to creating and supporting innovative student choreography and performance. HRMDC offers members weekly company classes, guest workshops, and the opportunity to perform and choreograph in the company's biannual shows.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Mozart Society Orchestra (MSO), founded in 1984, is Harvardâ€™s premier classical-sized orchestra, enjoying both the intimate music-making of a chamber orchestra and the power of masterpieces usually performed by symphony orchestras. Though musical excellence is its top concern, MSO also boasts one of the most friendly and collegial atmospheres among the musical ensembles on campus.
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35951" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35951', 'a-mission_35951', 'a-mission_35951');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We are a social club. There is nowhere else at Harvard that you'll find so many people who share your interests in speculative fiction, be it fantasy, science fiction, or otherwise, and gaming. We talk about these things. We play board games together. We sponsor guest speakers; in the past, we've had Joe Haldeman, Terry Pratchett, and Catherine Asaro. We have a library with more than 3000 books, and more board games than we have yet been able to count. Whatever nerdy experience you want, HRSFA can provide.
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35952" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35952', 'a-mission_35952', 'a-mission_35952');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We advocate for and advance the interests of our members both within the Physics Department and the broader academic community. Our mission is to maintain an active and recognized chapter that not only meets the standards of the National Society of Physics Students through the submission of annual reports and maintaining good standing but also engages actively with the student body through representation at university events, conferences, and activity fairs.<br><br>We endeavor to foster a collaborative and supportive environment for our members by managing seven undergraduate committees. We work closely with the Physics Department's leadership to ensure that our plans and initiatives align with academic standards and contribute positively to our members' educational experience.
							</p>

								HealthPath Horizons at Harvard is committed to addressing the critical disparities that prevent students from underserved and underrepresented backgrounds from accessing opportunities in the healthcare field. 								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Peer counseling is a service for Harvard undergrads to use when they need to need process concerns or experiences to another person, and itâ€™s in a confidential setting. Indigo strives to foster a supportive and compassionate campus for undergraduate students grappling with and addressing issues of race, ethnicity, socioeconomic status, first generation, immigration status, and other identity concerns at Harvard College. Indigo provides confidential non-directive, non-judgmental, peer counseling as well as informational resources for students. We seek to support students of all racial and socioeconomic backgrounds and help create an open and welcoming campus climate based on respect of all students.
							</p>

								Established as a memorial to President Kennedy, the IOPâ€™s mission is to unite and engage students, particularly undergraduates, with academics, politicians, activists, and policymakers on a non-partisan basis to inspire them to consider careers in politics and public service. Through our sixteen programs, internships, and conferences, the IOP offers wide-ranging opportunities for students to practice, get inspired, and gain the skills for a future in public service.
							</p>

											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Kidney Disease Screening and Awareness Program website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257501/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35967" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Kidney Disease Screening and Awareness Program" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35967', 'a-mission_35967', 'club_35967');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35967" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35967', 'a-mission_35967', 'a-mission_35967');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								KDSAP has two key objectives: student career development and community outreach. KDSAP is a student-run organization targeting college students and aims to provide opportunities for community outreach to raise public awareness and promote early detection of chronic kidney disease (CKD). In addition, KDSAP offers many innovative programs to benefit its student members, including speaker series each semester that expose students to scientific and medical professions while facilitating the development of mentor-mentee relationships. Members may also participate in community outreach and develop leadership skills by organizing, managing, and running monthly kidney health screenings in medically underserved communities.
							</p>

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Latinas Unidas de Harvard College website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257777/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35971" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Latinas Unidas de Harvard College" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35971', 'a-mission_35971', 'club_35971');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=f3af6565-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35971&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35971" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35971', 'a-mission_35971', 'a-mission_35971');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Latinas Unidas shall be the materialization of a vision: the unification of Harvard College students who have a passion for and/or interest in the lives of Latina women. LU provides a forum for community building, intellectual discussion, and the empowerment of women. We believe that our individual backgrounds, while diverse, combine to form a strong and unique culture. We foster this strength and unity through three main branches of action: 1) Advocacy Events 2) Social Events and 3) Professional Outreach. We believe and embrace the important responsibility to the Latinx and greater Latin American community to showcase the power of women, build communal ties, and establish long-lasting career pipelines.   
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35971").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35971").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_35971").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_35971").keyup(null);
												$("#club_35971").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
