							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35980" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35980', 'a-mission_35980', 'a-mission_35980');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of the Harvard MEDLIFE Club is to support global health equity by partnering with underserved communities to provide access to high-quality healthcare, education, and safe development projects. We empower students to become socially conscious leaders through hands-on service, health education, and advocacy. By working both locally in Boston and internationally through Service Learning Trips, we strive to address the root causes of poverty and promote long-term, sustainable change.
							</p>
							<script>

								- No Dues Required
							
						</p>

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Natives at Harvard College website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257534/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35986" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Natives at Harvard College" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35986', 'a-mission_35986', 'club_35986');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=f4f705c1-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35986&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35986" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35986', 'a-mission_35986', 'a-mission_35986');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Our mission is to create social, intellectual, and cultural activities for both Indigenous/Native students at Harvard and for other interested members of the Harvard community. We recognize that Indigenous/Native students are an ultra-minority and attempt to foster a sense of community among our members. We also try to educate the Harvard community about Indigenous/Native issues and debunk popular misconceptions of Indigenous/Native individuals through our activities and events.
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_35986").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_35986").keyup(null);

												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {

											} else {

						<div style="word-break: break-word;">
							

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Omo Naija x Wahala Boys: Harvard Undergraduate African Dance Troupe website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257923/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_35990" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Omo Naija x Wahala Boys: Harvard Undergraduate African Dance Troupe" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_35990', 'a-mission_35990', 'club_35990');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Lulu August" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2392930&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Lulu August</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=f554637c-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=35990&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_35990" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_35990', 'a-mission_35990', 'a-mission_35990');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of Omo Naija x The Wahala Boys is to educate the members of the greater Harvard community through dance and its role in the culture of the Afro-Caribbean. While dance is not generally imagined when one imagines education, the arts have historically served as some of the best cultural and educational tools available. While Omo Naija is close-knit, it is also a space for members of the African Diaspora across campus to find cultural roots, and to take part in the making and spreading of something amazing. Many on this campus know very little about Afro-Caribbean dance and culture and thus while we love that this organization is a fun way to express ourselves, it also serves as a community with which the Harvard community can engage, participate, and learn.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 1985, PBHAâ€™s CHANCE (College High-school Alliance: A Nexus for Creative Education) is a college preparatory program which strives to give students from local high schools the desire, support, and motivation to gain admission to college and to succeed there and beyond. CHANCE provides SAT tutoring, homework help, and college application advising to students in grades 9-12.Thanks to the F. Gardner Jackson Fund, CHANCE is able to award scholarships to students from local high schools. All who have regularly attended CHANCE and are in their junior or senior year are eligible.

							</a>
						
						</h2>

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the PBHA's Chinatown Big Sibling Program website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257739/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36015" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="PBHAâ€™s Chinatown Big Sibling Program" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36015', 'a-mission_36015', 'club_36015');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36015" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36015', 'a-mission_36015', 'a-mission_36015');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Chinatown Big Sib is a one-to-one mentorship program run by Harvard College students with the Phillips Brooks House Association. The program offers young children ages 6 to 12 years from the Boston Chinatown neighborhood a unique experience with getting to know and spending time with college students from the area. Our college student volunteers, or â€œBig Sibsâ€, are responsible for organizing one-on-one outings with their â€œLittle Sibsâ€ every other weekend. With these meetings and interactions, the program strives to build a strong relationship between Sib pairings. Big Sibs may take on the role of a mentor in academic, social, emotional context, or simply whatever best provides for their Little Sibs. This program runs full year, where Sib pairings remain the same throughout both semesters unless other arrangements are made. 
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36015").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36015").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36015").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36015").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36015").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36025" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36025', 'a-mission_36025', 'a-mission_36025');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								ExperiMentors is committed to addressing the critical need for accessible STEM education and inspiring the next generation of scientists, scholars, and innovators. Together, we strive to empower elementary school students in Cambridge to explore science through hands-on, curiosity-driven learning beyond the limitations of traditional textbooks. Additionally, ExperiMentors aims to foster a lasting network of volunteers, teachers, and students, united by a shared passion for scientific learning. Through meaningful collaboration, we cultivate a space where learning thrives, curiosity is celebrated, and young minds are excited to question, explore, and lead.<br>
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36025").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36025").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36025").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36025").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36025").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});

								The Harvard Square Homeless Shelter provides roughly 15-20 homeless individuals at a time with a safe, clean, and caring place to stay during the winter months. 								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								PBHAâ€™s Student Labor Action Movement (SLAM) is committed to activism and education in support of social and economic justice. Made up of Harvard students, workers, and activists, SLAM organizes in support of workersâ€™ rights and a more equitable Harvard community. SLAM campaigns have been directed toward worker and labor issues on campus and on a national level; they include the Living Wage Campaign and the Ethical Investments and Contracting, as well as campaigns initiated by local unions and community organizations. SLAM members participate in and help lead campaigns, as well as organize new ones.
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36059" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36059', 'a-mission_36059', 'a-mission_36059');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Undergraduate Legal Committee (HULC) gets students excited about legal aid, public interest law, and public service through volunteering with pro bono organizations throughout the Greater Boston Area and consistent programming that educates members on the pathways to and impact of legal advocacy.
							</p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_whatwedo_36059" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_whatwedo_36059', 'a-member-benefits_36059', 'a-member-benefits_36059');"><strong>Membership Benefits</strong><br>The Harvard Undergraduate Legal Committee (HULC) trains students in emotional sensitivity to underscore legal aid as a form of care and pairs volunteers to serve with community partners (public interest law organizations in the Greater Boston area) that focus on a wide range of legal advocacy areas, including immigration, housing, employment, family law, education, criminal justice, and consumer protection. HULC also runs community-building opportunities through the HULC Families program and socials while inviting individuals who have devoted themselves to public interest law to come share their wisdom via the professor and pro bono attorney speaker event series. </p>

									<a id="a-mission_36061" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="PBHAâ€™s Y2Y Harvard Square" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36061', 'a-mission_36061', 'club_36061');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36061" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36061', 'a-mission_36061', 'a-mission_36061');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Y2Y Harvard Square (Y2Y), a student-run overnight shelter, employs a youth-to-youth model to provide a safe and affirming environment for young adults experiencing homelessness. Y2Y guests will have opportunities to collaborate with service providers, other young adults experiencing homelessness, and student volunteers to create sustainable pathways out of homelessness and develop skills for long-term success. Y2Y provides opportunities for both guests and volunteers to become the next generationâ€™s leading advocates for young adult-driven solutions to homelessness.<br>
							</p>

									<a id="a-mission_36091" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="STRIVE" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36091', 'a-mission_36091', 'club_36091');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Lily Song" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2394644&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Lily Song</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=fe4f8940-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=36091&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>

							<p></p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								STRIVE provides an opportunity for fun and recluse from the busy student life on Saturdays and accrue volunteer hours without even realizing it. <br><br>STRIVE, under the larger non-profit organization NextStep,  is a program designed to connect Harvard mentors with  youth with sickle-cell anemia from Boston area middle and high schools.

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36092" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36092', 'a-mission_36092', 'a-mission_36092');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								STAHR is focused on providing students the opportunity to learn about and engage in recreational astronomy. STAHR also seeks to promote interest in science and foster a healthy, inclusive community centered around our common interests. STAHR provides students with education in recreational astronomy with its Telescope Training Classes at the Loomis-Michael Observatory. Students who successfully complete the semester-long class receive HUID card access to the Loomis-Michael Observatory for the remainder of their degree program at Harvard University. STAHR is committed to offering advanced instruction in observational astronomy subjects, including, but not limited to astrophotography, to further studentsâ€™ knowledge in the field. STAHR is committed to holding community events, including its semesterly dark sky trips, open house observatory nights, and movie nights. In addition, STAHR is committed to helping the student community learn about opportunities in astronomy through initiatives including, but not limited to, speaking engagements with professionals in the sciences. 
							</p>

									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the Tempus: The Harvard College History Review website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="http://www.hcs.harvard.edu/~tempus/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36099" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Tempus: The Harvard College History Review" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36099', 'a-mission_36099', 'club_36099');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Alia Al-Wir" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2392073&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Alia Al-Wir</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=ff107ce5-a4a1-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=36099&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36099" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36099', 'a-mission_36099', 'a-mission_36099');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								â€œTempus: The Harvard College History Review is the undergraduate journal of the Harvard History Department. The journal was founded by Adam G. Beaver and Sujit M. Raman in 1998 to publish original historical scholarship by undergraduates. In the spring of 2009, Tempus transitioned to an online format. After a brief return to print from the spring of 2013 to the spring of 2019, and a second digital stint during the COVID-19 pandemic, Tempus is now a hybrid publication with both digital and print issues. Any Harvard undergraduate can submit a history paper to the Editorial Staff for consideration for the Journal; most submissions are papers first prepared for Harvard classes. Works in the Forum and Profiles are authored by Tempus editors. To submit a paper, please email the Editorial Staff at tempus.thchr@gmail.com. Additional information and past issues may be found online at www.tempusharvard.org. This issue is printed with the generosity of the Harvard University Department of History.â€<br>
							</p>

								$("#club_36099").on('focus', function() {
									$("#club_36099").keyup(null);
									setTimeout(function() {
										var isActive = false;
										$("#club_36099").keyup(function(event) {
											if (isActive) {
												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {
												$("#club_36099").keyup(null);
												$("#club_36099").click();
											} else {
												isActive = false;
											}
										});
									}, 250);
								});
							</script>

									<a id="a-mission_36103" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="The Cuban-American Undergraduate Student Association" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36103', 'a-mission_36103', 'club_36103');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36103" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36103', 'a-mission_36103', 'a-mission_36103');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We, the members of The Cuban-American Undergraduate Student Association (CAUSA) at Harvard University, establish this constitution in recognition of the heritage of Cuba, with a special focus on Afro-Cuban and Indigenous Cuban identities, and with a commitment to building community and sustaining engagement among Cuban and Cuban-American undergraduate students. Inspired by principles of unity, inclusivity, and mutual respect, we pledge to create a supportive environment where members can explore, celebrate, and advocate for the diverse experiences and perspectives within the Cuban identity. With a dedication to promoting awareness, dialogue, and collaboration, we uphold the value of contributing positively to our community, university, and beyond. In witness whereof, we affirm this constitution to guide our actions and aspirations as members of CAUSA, committed to the advancement of our shared mission and the empowerment of all who join us on this journey.
							</p>

Members are willing to drop anything to support one another in times of need, and in times of celebration. Friendship and adventure frequently craft some of our membersâ€™ favorite memories from Harvard.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Callbacks is an independent, nonprofit, student-run, and student-produced singing group at Harvard College. The Callbacks are dedicated to enriching both the musical and performing arts communities of Harvard University through original arrangements and live performance. The group seeks to foster a vibrant musical atmosphere at Harvard by offering both free and paid performances on campus, as well as participating in community-oriented music events.

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Crimson is the only breakfast-table daily newspaper in Cambridge, Mass. The Crimson publishes every morning, Monday through Friday, except on federal and University holidays, and prints weekly on Fridays. The Crimson publishes an Arts section on Tuesdays. Fifteen Minutes, the magazine of The Crimson, publishes weekly online and prints a monthly glossy edition.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The mission of The Harvard Krokodiloes (hereafter â€œKrokodiloesâ€) is to spread the joy and the value of its music in the hopes of enriching the audiencesâ€™ and the membersâ€™ lives through the powers of human sharing. As Harvardâ€™s oldest a cappella singing group, the Krokodiloes are a versatile group of twelve tuxedo-clad undergraduates who sing jazz, swing, ballads, and rock music from the 20th century and beyond to audiences all over the world. Apart from the numerous performances at Harvardâ€™s campus and in and around the Greater Boston Area, the Krokodiloes every year embark on a Winter Tour to North American destinations, a Spring Tour to Bermuda, and a flagship Summer World Tour that advance the TTBB-identified mission of the group onto the global scene.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Salient fights to restore Harvard's traditions of free speech, intellectual rigor, and open debate. Through our publication, campus headquarters, and sponsored events, The Harvard Salient builds a powerful community of conservative students, alumni, and faculty who combat the ideological uniformity of Harvard Universityâ€™s campus.<br>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36118" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36118', 'a-mission_36118', 'a-mission_36118');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								We're THUD (The Harvard Undergraduate Drummers), a student-run organization at Harvard College that likes to get together on Sundays afternoons Monday evenings and hit things. We play everything with percussive potential: drum set battles, arrangements of pop and classical music, original pieces on found instruments like plastic cups and chalkboards, drumming on buckets, and more. Inspirations include STOMP and the Blue Man Group. We perform around Harvard Square when it's nice out and are available for gigs in the Cambridge and Boston area. Our work culminates at the end of each semester with our shows.
							</p>

							Religious and Spiritual Life

								<span data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-original-title="Sent an Email!" class="aria-tooltip" aria-label="Tooltip. Sent an Email!" role="tooltip" tabindex="0"><img src="/upload/harvard/2023/small_image_upload_34747_BadgeIcon_127133918.png" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='/images/listing-default.png'" class="badge-radius" style="margin:1px;vertical-align: middle;width:25px;height:25px"></span>

							<p class="h5 media-heading" style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the The Harvard Undergraduate Ichthus website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/257967/"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36114" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="The Harvard Undergraduate Ichthus" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36114', 'a-mission_36114', 'club_36114');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36114" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36114', 'a-mission_36114', 'a-mission_36114');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard Ichthus is a journal of Christian thought.  It exists for the purpose of fostering deep Christian thought among the members of the Harvard community, taking seriously the motto of Harvard University: â€œVeritas Christo et Ecclesiae,â€ in English â€œTruth for Christ and the Church.â€  It adopts these words of the Rev. Prof. Peter J. Gomes, preached at the Memorial Church, as its mission statement:<br><br>"There is a rumor about, and fanned in certain quarters, that this University<br>has long since abandoned its ancient motto and is conformable only <br>to â€˜Veritas.â€™  That simply is not true.  The seal by which the President and <br>Fellows of Harvard College continue to conduct their business is still the seal that says: â€˜Veritas Christo et Ecclesiae.â€™  One cannot undo the past, and in this particular case one should not undo the past. The university-- and this University in particular-- is in the business of goodness and virtue <br>personified, and not simply in the bottom lines of fairness and excellence.   <br>Christ and the Church were an essential part of that truth to which Harvard and the generations of its children were committed.  ...Truth for Christ and the Church is not here by accident or by sufferance; it is here by design and intent.  ...Indeed, as a symbol of Christian truth, we are here to remind <br>Harvard of a dimension beyond its own self-interest and self-perception... We Christians must never forget, nor must we permit our College or our University ever to forget, that knowledge without virtue is a destructive danger that produces arrogant technocrats who are a danger to all that is holy, hopeful, lovely, and true, and who must be resisted.  Our pious ancestors understood this, and thus they dedicated this small, fragile College in the wilderness to a truth that was seen in and for Christ and the Church.  Veritas-- that is, true Veritas, and not simply correct information-- can never be separated from the one in whom it is most perfectly and fully seen: Jesus Christ.  Not everyone may believe that, but those of us who do must not be intimidated by those who don't, and we must be emboldened to claim that truth not only as our own but as one that is essential to the definition of a University and College worthy of the name."<br><br>(Strength for the Journey, pgs. 56, 60)
							</p>

									</p><div style="border-top:1px solid #ccc; margin-top:15px">
										<p style="margin-top:10px"> <span class="mdi mdi-comment-text-outline aria-decorative" style="color: #337ab7;" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span> Contact: <a class="thickboxWhite" title="Send a Message to Aditya Tummala" href="https://soco.college.harvard.edu/user_chat?sid=2391804&amp;position=right&amp;modal=true&amp;mode=set&amp;embed=1&amp;width=700&amp;TB_iframe=true">Aditya Tummala</a>, <a title="Send a message to the group:" href="javascript:;" onclick="openModal('/send_message_boot?club_uid=00e12204-a4a2-11ec-84cd-0ec578521fa5&amp;club_id=36119&amp;ax=1&amp;async=1&amp;modal=true');">Email group officers</a></p>
									</div>	
								
							<p></p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36119" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36119', 'a-mission_36119', 'a-mission_36119');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								Founded in 2007, The Harvard Undergraduate Research Journal (THURJ) strives to publicize and spread recognition of original work by undergraduates in Harvard's undergraduate programs. THURJ serves as an ambassador of Harvard's undergraduate research activities at a university more known for its graduate programs.<br>THURJ showcases peer-reviewed undergraduate student research from all research disciplines, including the natural sciences, the social sciences, and the humanities.<br>A biannual publication, THURJ gives students an opportunity to be involved with the entire research publication process, beginning with manuscript submission and evaluation, ranging through design and ending with dissemination of results. Moreover, THURJ provides a comprehensive forum for discourse on the cutting-edge research that impacts our world today.
							</p>

									<a aria-label="Website" aria-description="Open the The Harvard University Jazz Bands website in a new tab." style="margin-right: 15px;" target="_blank" href="http://harvardjazzbands.com"><span class="mdi mdi-web aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Website</a>
								
									<a id="a-mission_36120" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="The Harvard University Jazz Bands" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36120', 'a-mission_36120', 'club_36120');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>
								
							</p>


							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36120" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36120', 'a-mission_36120', 'a-mission_36120');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Harvard College Jazz Bands strive to promote awareness and appreciation of instrumental jazz at Harvard through annual performances of classic music of master composers as well as contemporary pieces, hosting of guest artists, and commissioning of new works. In pursuit of this goal, the Jazz Bands host fall and spring concerts featuring guest artists spanning the history of jazz, as well as other concerts throughout the year. 
							</p>
							<script>
								$("#club_36120").on('focus', function() {

												return;
											}
											isActive = true;
											if (event.which === 13) {

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The River Charles Ensemble, Harvardâ€™s premier conductor-less chamber orchestra, is dedicated to the highest quality of music-making and performance. Formed in the spring of 2012, the River Charles Ensemble is a community of musicians who believe in the power and application of chamber music techniques to solo and orchestral performances. Using a democratic and collective approach, the orchestra is dedicated to working with student musicians of all kinds and strongly believes in musical collaborations all across the Harvard community. The musicians of the River Charles Ensemble share a passion for this distinctive and innovative approach to music.
							</p>

								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Wellness Educators (WEs) are the undergraduate peer education arm of CWHP. WEs work alongside the CWHP to engage the Harvard College community in health promotion and cultivate all aspects of student health and wellbeing (physical, relational, emotional, financial, spiritual, environmental, intellectual, and vocational). WEs connect our community to health resources, wellness information and practices, and promote holistic wellbeing for all students.<br> <br>

								Founded in 2001, the Undergraduate Mariachi VÃ©ritas is Harvardâ€™s one and only mariachi. We strive to create spaces to learn about and showcase Mexican culture through traditional music, while also presenting members from all communities a chance to perform it. Through a dedication to musical excellence and our core values, each member will not only add to our rich and diverse history, but will help foster a stronger, more united community both on campus and in the greater Boston community. Through this process, we will help foster a strong, united, and supportive ensemble.

									<a id="a-mission_36151" aria-label="Mission" aria-description="Woodbridge International Society" style="margin-right: 15px;" href="javascript:toggle_ecg('club_36151', 'a-mission_36151', 'club_36151');"><span class="mdi mdi-checkbox-marked-circle-outline aria-decorative" role="presentation" aria-hidden="true"></span>Mission</a>

							<p style="display:none" class="noOutlineOnFocus" tabindex="0" id="club_36151" onclick="toggle_ecg('club_36151', 'a-mission_36151', 'a-mission_36151');">
								<strong>Mission</strong><br>
								The Woodbridge Society aims to support international college students and foster the international community. The Society aims to provide a social and intellectual forum for individuals from all over the world, educate members of the Harvard College community on issues of international importance, build a global network among students of the College, and foster a spirit of global awareness and cultural exchange. The Society advocates for the international community by maintaining strong relationships with the relevant Harvard offices, connecting students to resources, and organizing events.
							</p>

							<div class="fixed--bottom text-center" role="listitem">
								
								<script type="text/javascript">
									function check_more_details() {
										var arr_ids = [];
										$('input[name=clubs]:checked').map(function() {
										    arr_ids.push($(this).val());
										});
										var submit = 1;
	
										for (x = 0; x < arr_ids.length; x++) {
											if ( document.getElementById("cb_club_" + arr_ids[x]).checked ) {
												if (document.getElementById("more_details_" + arr_ids[x]).value == "") {
													submit = 0;
												}
											}
										}
										if (submit == 0) {
											alert("You must fill out the More Details text boxes of the selected groups.");
											return false;
										} else {
											return true;
										}
									}
									function check_waiver() {
										var arr_ids = [];
										$('input[name=clubs]:checked').map(function() {
										    arr_ids.push($(this).val());
										});
										var submit = 1;
	
										for (x = 0; x < arr_ids.length; x++) {
											if ( document.getElementById("cb_club_" + arr_ids[x]).checked && document.getElementById("waiver_" + arr_ids[x])) {
												if ((!document.getElementById("waiver_" + arr_ids[x]).checked && $("#waiver_" + arr_ids[x]).is(":visible")) || ($("#waiver_signature_" + arr_ids[x]).val() === "" &&  $("#waiver_signature_" + arr_ids[x]).is(":visible"))) {
													submit = 0;
												}
											}
										}
										if (submit == 0) {
											alert("You must agree and sign all the waivers of the groups you selected.");
											return false;
										} else {
											return true;
										}
									}
									function check_membership_option() {
										var arr_ids = [];
										$('input[name=clubs]:checked').map(function() {
										    arr_ids.push($(this).val());
										});
										var submit = 1;
	
										for (x = 0; x < arr_ids.length; x++) {
											if ( document.getElementById("cb_club_" + arr_ids[x]).checked ) {
												if (document.getElementById("club_options_" + arr_ids[x])) {
													if (document.getElementById("club_options_" + arr_ids[x]).value == "") {
														submit = 0;
													}
												}
											}
										}
										if (submit == 0) {
											alert("You must select a Membership Option for each of the applicable selected groups.");
											return false;
										} else {
											return true;
										}
									}

								</script>
								
									<input onclick="javascript: var waiver = check_waiver(); var membership_option = check_membership_option(); if (waiver &amp;&amp; membership_option) {return check_more_details();} else {return false;}" class="btn btn-cg--group" type="submit" role="button" name="Submit" value="  Join  " style="margin-top: 10px;">
								
							</div>
						
					</ul>
